body: Hyperloop Transportation Technologies' Co-founder Bibop Gresta has said India can have a hyperloop in 38 months if the government is serious. "We're ready with the technology and we can bring money. We just need land and a commitment from the government," he added. Hyperloop refers to a technology which transports people in pods at high speeds along specially built tubes.

headline: Takata to pay $1 billion over faulty airbags that killed 16
body: Japanese automobile parts maker Takata on Monday pleaded guilty to fraud and agreed to pay $1 billion for concealing an airbag defect that caused at least 16 deaths. Takata admitted hiding evidence that its airbag inflators could explode with too much force, hurling lethal shrapnel into passengers. Over 31 million cars have been recalled worldwide over the faulty airbags.

headline: Billionaire's ₹2,800 crore superyacht with helipad seized
body: Russian billionaire Andrey Melnichenko's ₹2,800 crore superyacht 'Sailing Yacht A' has been seized before delivery over unpaid bills to the shipbuilder Nobiskrug. The yacht, which is one of the largest sailing yachts in the world, is taller than the Big Ben tower and longer than 13 buses. It also has a helipad, a swimming pool and an underwater observation pod.

headline: Startup builds hovering bike for ₹1 crore
body: Russian startup Hoversurf has built the 'Hoverbike Scorpion-3', a ₹1 crore manned hovering bike that can go up to 33 feet high in the air and hit speeds of 48 kmph. The electric bike can remain airborne for up to 27 minutes on a single charge. The bike's creators claim that the bike can be driven without any prior experience.

headline: Man who stole ₹1 crore Maserati during test drive arrested
body: A Florida man accused of stealing a Maserati GranTurismo car worth $1,50,000 (nearly ₹1 crore) by fooling the salesman during a test drive has been arrested. The 45-year-old was tracked using his driver's licence that he had presented to the dealership when he initially took the car. However, according to reports, the car has not been recovered yet.

headline: 10 supercars seized in Chennai for illegal racing
body: Chennai police on Sunday impounded 10 supercars that were allegedly involved in illegal racing in the city. The cars, estimated to be worth around ₹30 crore in total, include two Lamborghinis, a Ferrari, and an Audi. According to the police, the cars were being driven at 180 kmph on a 60 kmph stretch.

headline: Tesla, Ford only US car startups that aren't bankrupt: Musk
body: In an email to employees, electric carmaker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk said, "We should never forget the history of car startups originating in the United States: dozens have gone bankrupt and only two, Tesla and Ford, have not." Addressing claims of poor compensation and safety conditions at Tesla, Musk added, "The forces arrayed against us are many and incredibly powerful."

headline: Google's suit baseless attempt to slow down competitor: Uber
body: Ride-hailing startup Uber has called allegations by Google spinoff Waymo that Uber stole its self-driving car technology a "baseless attempt to slow down a competitor". Waymo's lawsuit claims that a former Google engineer stole 14,000 confidential documents, which he used to build cars for Uber's autonomous truck subsidiary Otto. Waymo is seeking the return of the allegedly stolen materials.

headline: Ford denies its staff sleeps while testing self-driving cars
body: American automaker Ford has denied a report by Bloomberg that its engineers have been falling asleep while testing the company's self-driving cars. However, Ford noted that "high levels of automation without full autonomy capability could provide a false sense of security" to drivers. Ford's autonomous vehicle plan includes removing the car's brake pedals, gas pedals and steering wheel.

headline: In pictures: Vintage car rally organised in Delhi NCR
body: The 7th edition of the 21 Gun Salute International Vintage Car Rally and Concours Show was organised in Delhi NCR from February 17. More than 100 vintage cars from makers like Benz, Moon Motor Car, Fiat, Ford and Rolls-Royce participated in the event. The show is organised every year as a tribute to maintaining and restoring of iconic car models.

headline: Traffic jams cost US drivers ₹80,000 a year: Study
body: Traffic jams cost US drivers an average of $1,200 (over ₹80,000) a year in wasted fuel and time, a study has revealed. Drivers in Los Angeles reportedly spent the most time, an average of 104 peak drive-time hours, fighting slow traffic in 2016. New York, San Francisco, Atlanta and Miami followed Los Angeles as the most traffic-choked US cities.

headline: Man arrested for selling over 50 stolen bikes on OLX, Quikr
body: Delhi Police have arrested a man named Sarfaraj Ahmed for stealing more than 50 motorcycles and selling them on used vehicle platforms like OLX and Quikr. As many as 18 costly motorcycles and scooters were recovered from him along with fake number plates, IDs and SIM cards. Ahmed had rented a room in Delhi's Matiala to store the stolen vehicles.

headline: How much do supercars cost around the world?
body: Most luxury automakers like Bentley and Lamborghini have stable base pricing around the world, but governmental tariffs vary greatly. For example, the Rolls-Royce Ghost is priced at over ₹4 crore in Mumbai, which is an increase of more than 200% over its UK price. Similarly, the price of a Cadillac CT6 is roughly 85% more in Tokyo than in Canada.

headline: Cars pollute and kill us by running over us: Rajiv Bajaj
body: In a recent event when Bajaj Auto's Managing Director Rajiv Bajaj was asked about a Bajaj-branded car launch, he said, "Cars are too big, too fast, they pollute, they congest and they kill all of us because they run over us". He added, "We are an anti-car company. We feel that people should either walk, cycle, use two-wheelers or three-wheelers".

headline: Female engineer accuses Tesla of sexism, harassment
body: A female engineer at American carmaker Tesla has accused the Elon Musk-led company of ignoring her complaints of "pervasive harassment" and paying her a lower salary than men doing the same work. The engineer's discrimination lawsuit, filed last year, also claims harassment from men on the factory floor "including... inappropriate language, whistling, and cat calls."

headline: Ford files patent for head-rest with secret travel pillow
body: US-based automaker Ford has filed a patent for a head-rest with a built-in secret compartment that can hide a wrap-around neck pillow. The design of the headrest features a hidden door that allows it to split in two, revealing the concealed pillow. Ford has noted that this feature will facilitate 'napping' and represent 'a significant advance in passenger comfort'.

headline: Carlos Ghosn to step down as Nissan CEO after 16 years
body: Japanese automaker Nissan has announced that Carlos Ghosn will step aside as CEO after leading the company for 16 years. Ghosn, who joined Nissan as Chief Operating Officer in June 1999, will continue to be Chairman at Nissan, Renault, and Mitsubishi. Hiroto Saikawa, a company veteran of 40 years, will take over from Ghosn from April 1.

headline: Startup unveils self-driving race car with 320kmph top speed
body: Britain-based race series for driverless electric cars Roborace has unveiled its first self-driving race car 'Robocar' which has a top speed of 320 kmph. The Robocar is bigger than a standard Formula 1 car and measures 4.5 metres long and 2 metres wide. It has two radars, five LiDARs, 18 ultrasonic sensors, two optical speed sensors and six AI-driven cameras.

headline: Tesla CFO quits months before new car Model 3's launch
body: Tesla's Chief Financial Officer Jason Wheeler has quit the company months before the electric vehicle maker is set to launch its new car 'Model 3'. Tesla's former CFO, Deepak Ahuja, will return to the company next month to replace Wheeler. Set to launch in July, Model 3 will be the cheapest car launched by Tesla to date.

headline: World's first driverless car circuit race ends with a crash
body: The first race between two driverless cars, which was hosted by Formula E's Buenos Aires ePrix on Saturday, ended after one of the cars crashed into a statue. While still in testing phase, the winning car 'Devbot1' reached a top speed of 186 kmph. The driverless cars' racing league, Roborace tweeted, "No drivers were harmed though!"

headline: Tesla announces plan to build 3 new Gigafactories
body: Elon Musk-led electric carmaker Tesla has announced plans to build three more 'Gigafactories' in addition to the ones being built in Nevada and New York. The upcoming 6 million-square-foot Gigafactory in Nevada is touted to be the world's biggest building by footprint. The lithium-ion battery factory will reportedly also have the world's largest rooftop solar array once it is operational.

headline: China orders cars in violence-hit area to install GPS system
body: Chinese authorities have ordered all vehicles in the violence-hit region of Bayingol, Xinjiang to be installed with GPS tracking devices as an anti-terror measure. "Cars are the main transportation means for terrorists, and a frequently chosen tool to carry out attacks," said Bayingol traffic police. Cars without the tracking devices will not be able to buy petrol in the region.

headline: Tesla's stock surges by 48% in 3 months to rival Ford, GM
body: According to a Bloomberg report, electric car maker Tesla's stock has surged by 48% in the past three months, despite analysts considering it overvalued. The Elon Musk-led startup has become one of America's 'Big Three' automobile companies in terms of market value, joining General Motors and Ford. Tesla delivered around 80,000 cars in 2016.

headline: Mercedes to launch the new E-class on 28th February
body: Luxury car-maker Mercedes-Benz is ready to launch one of the most awaited luxury saloons for 2017, the fifth generation of E-Class in India. With this product, Mercedes would create a new benchmark in driving dynamics, rear seat comfort and safety. For the first time in this segment, the E-Class will have rear seats that can recline.

headline: Almost all cars will be self-driving in 10 years, says Musk
body: While launching Tesla in Dubai on Monday, the electric vehicle startup's Co-founder Elon Musk said in 10 years it will be very unusual for cars to be built that are not fully self-driving. "Getting in a car will be just like getting in an elevator...You just tell it where you want to go and it takes you there," he added.

headline: World's first commercial flying car goes on sale at ₹2.67 cr
body: The world's first commercially available flying car made by Dutch company PAL-V, 'Liberty' on Tuesday went for pre-order at a starting price of ₹2.67 crore. The three-wheeled vehicle has a retractable top-mounted rotor and can be in flight for up to 4.3 hours non-stop. It has a top speed of 160km/h on the ground and 180km/h in the air.

headline: Tesla stock hits record high as it debuts in Dubai
body: The stock of Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla on Monday hit a record high after a 4% rise, the same day it launched the online booking of its cars in UAE. Tesla stock witnessed its last all-time closing high in July 2015. Tesla is currently gearing up for its third car launch, the Model 3.

headline: Rolls-Royce posts its largest-ever loss over bribery scandal
body: British automobile maker Rolls-Royce on Tuesday reported a record loss of £4.6 billion (over ₹38,600 crore) for 2016, reflecting a fine to settle bribery charges and the weak pound. Rolls-Royce agreed to pay £671 million (over ₹5,500 crore) in January to authorities in Britain, Brazil, and the US. The amount, which is payable over five years, has been booked together.

headline: Tata Motors loses ₹15,000 cr after shares fall most in 5 yrs
body: India’s largest automaker by revenue, Tata Motors on Wednesday lost over ₹15,000 crore from its market value after its shares closed down 10.3%, its biggest fall in five years. The company's stock was the worst performer among the Sensex-30 companies. The slump comes a day after Tata Motors reported 96% dip in its profit for the third quarter ended December.

headline: Toyota recalls all Mirai cars over software glitch
body: Japanese carmaker Toyota has recalled all of its zero-emission Mirai cars globally over a software glitch that can shut off the car's hydrogen power system. Mirai, which means 'future' in Japanese, was launched in December 2014. The recall is expected to affect nearly 2,800 Mirai cars, software of which will be updated by the company free of cost.

headline: Suit claims Porsche hid emails about Paul Walker's car crash
body: According to the lawsuit filed by Paul Walker's daughter against Porsche, the carmaker concealed emails that proved Porsche knew that the car the actor died in was dangerous. The email in question was reportedly exchanged between employees and said, "Another Carrera GT bites the dust...Total worldwide production of the Carrera GT was 1280 and to date...200 of them already totaled."

headline: Poets will save the world, not technology: Anand Mahindra
body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Friday said, "It is going to be poets, writers, musicians who will save the world, not technology... It is the people who use their imagination..." He said this in response to being asked whether technology could save the world. Mahindra later tweeted, "I have never been clearer in my mind about an answer."

headline: Tata Motors, Microsoft to make India's first connected car
body: Tata Motors on Thursday announced a partnership with technology major Microsoft to develop India's first cloud-connected smart cars. The first vehicle showcasing the companies' technology will be unveiled at the Geneva International Motor Show on March 7 under the newly launched 'TAMO' brand. This comes after Tata Motors said it would premiere its first sports car 'Futuro' at the event.

headline: Audi dealers demand ₹27,000 crore to cover losses of 3 years
body: Audi dealers in China are demanding $4 billion (around ₹27,000 crore) to cover losses over the past three years. The dealers blamed the automaker for adding too many distributors, which potentially worsened a sales decline that saw BMW and Mercedes-Benz overtake the luxury brand last month. Notably, Audi lost its leadership in China’s premium car segment as deliveries fell 35%.

headline: Honda has no plans to launch a car under ₹5 lakh in India
body: Japanese carmaker Honda has no plans to launch a car costing under ₹5 lakh in India, Honda India's President and CEO Yoichiro Ueno said. "Maybe it is not our market. We are talking about a couple of years. In the long term...we might consider," he added. Notably, sub-₹5 lakh segment accounts for nearly 50% of passenger vehicles sold in India.

headline: Toyota sold only 1 Prius in China in over 6 months
body: Japanese carmaker Toyota sold only one unit of its gas-electric hybrid car Prius in China in the second half of 2016, down from 75 in the first 6 months. Toyota stopped producing Prius in China in 2015, subjecting buyers to 25% customs tax on the imported cars. With the added taxes, Prius sedan costs at par with Audi Q3 SUV.

headline: Tata Motors Q3 profit tanks 96% on loss in India operations
body: Tata Motors on Tuesday reported its third-quarter earnings where its profit plummeted 96% over lower sales at its luxury car unit Jaguar Land Rover Automotive and losses in India. Net profit fell to ₹111.57 crore in the quarter ended December 31, from ₹2,952.67 crore in the year-ago period. Tata Motors attributed the loss in the domestic vehicle market to demonetisation.

headline: Trump will make America great to invest in: Anand Mahindra
body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Friday said President Donald Trump's programme to ‘Make America Great Again’ will make US a great place to invest in. Mahindra further said Trump’s presidency presented an opportunity for India to play a more important role in the world. “India can serve as a bridge-builder at a time when nations are separating,” he stated.

headline: Musk slammed for claiming Tesla worker was paid to agitate
body: America's United Automobile Workers union has rejected a charge by Tesla CEO Elon Musk that a factory worker who publicly criticised the company was paid by the organisation. "We hope Tesla would apologise to their employee for spreading fake news about him," said the union organisation. The worker had complained of injuries, unfair promotions and low pay at Tesla.

headline: London to levy a daily fine of ₹800 on polluting cars
body: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has said that the city will start levying a daily 'toxicity charge' of about ₹800 on 'polluting' vehicles, typically registered before 2006. He described the fine as "the toughest emission standard of any world city." This will be in addition to London's Congestion Charge, which applies from Monday to Friday between 7:00 AM and 6:00 PM.

headline: Disappointed at the sale of Ambassador brand, say Unions
body: Trade Unions have said, "It is disappointing that the management has sold the brand Ambassador while dues to the workers still remain unresolved." The “intuition of the management” is to sell off everything and “deprive workers”, they added. Notably, Hindustan Motors signed an agreement with Peugeot to sell the iconic Ambassador brand for ₹80 crore.

headline: 3 held in Spain for turning Toyota cars into fake Ferraris
body: Spanish police have arrested three people after raiding a workshop where Ferrari and Lamborghini body kits were being bolted onto second-hand Toyota and Ford cars. The investigation was launched when the group attempted to sell a vehicle online for ₹29 lakh. Additionally, the group's leader had a fully equipped facility for the cultivation of marijuana with 950 prepared pots.

headline: Musk rewards Tesla owner who damaged own car to save a life
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the carmaker will provide free repairs to a Tesla Model S owner who damaged his car to save another driver's life. The driver swerved his car in front of a Volkswagen after noticing that the driver appeared to be unconscious. The collision that halted both the cars caused damages worth about ₹7 lakh.

headline: Ford invests ₹1,300 crore on tunnel to blast wind at 320kmph
body: Ford has announced a $200 million (over ₹1,300 crore) investment to build a wind tunnel complex which will simulate airflow of up to 320 kmph. The complex will also have a climatic chamber with temperature ranging from -40° Celsius to 60° Celsius. Spread across 13 acres, the complex is aimed at improving fuel economy of both production and racing vehicles.

headline: Ambassador was sold due to lack of innovation: Giriraj Singh
body: Union Minister of State for MSME, Giriraj Singh on Saturday said that lack of innovation in Hindustan Motors led to the sale of iconic Ambassador car brand to Europe's Peugeot. The manufacturing of Ambassador was discontinued in 2014. It was sold to Peugeot a week ago in a deal worth ₹80 crore.

headline: Tesla rival Lucid Motors tests its electric car in -18°F
body: Electric vehicle startup Tesla's rival Lucid Motors has released a video which shows its first car 'Air' being tested in snow, ice and mixed road conditions, and temperatures below -18°F. Unveiled in December, Air churns out 1,000 horsepower and claims to travel up to 640 kilometres per charge. It is expected to launch in 2018 at around ₹66.84 lakh.

headline: Lamborghini recalls 5,900 supercars after 7 cars catch fire
body: Italian luxury automobile manufacturer Lamborghini has recalled 5,900 supercars after confirming 7 instances of fire because of a fuel system fault. The recall includes the ₹2.6 crore Aventadors and each of the 12 limited edition Venenos, priced at about ₹26 crore. According to the recall statement, gasoline coming in contact with hot exhaust parts caused the fires.

headline: 'Made in India' is becoming 'Mad in India', says Rajiv Bajaj
body: Bajaj Auto Managing Director Rajiv Bajaj on Thursday said stifling innovation will turn 'Made in India' into 'Mad in India'. "If your innovation...depends on government approval...it will not be a case of 'Made in India', but 'Mad in India'," Bajaj said, adding that India is the only country that has not given the company permission to sell its four-wheeler.

headline: Anand Mahindra tweets on S Korean drivers' accident response
body: Mahindra Group's Executive Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday tweeted a video of South Korean drivers' response to a tunnel accident with the caption, "It's the kind of culture we need...everywhere, in all things." The 45-second video shows drivers parking their cars to the tunnel's sides in an orderly manner to make way for police and medical help.

headline: Mercedes launches ‘Night Edition’ of luxury compacts A & B-Class
body: India’s leading luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz launched the A-Class and B-Class ‘Night Edition’ cars starting at ₹27.31 lakh (ex-showroom, Pune). “The trendy and fashionable ‘Night Edition’ are a synthesis of youthful design, modern luxury and fantastic performance, designed for the ‘go getters’ who believe in arriving in style wherever they go,” said Roland Folger, MD & CEO, Mercedes-Benz India.

headline: Lamborghini India launches Huracán RWD Spyder at ₹3.45 crore
body: Italian luxury sports car maker Lamborghini on Wednesday launched Huracán RWD Spyder in India at ₹3.45 crore (ex-showroom, New Delhi). The drop-top version of Hurácan RWD coupe can accelerate from 0 to 100 kmph in just 3.6 seconds and reach a maximum speed of 319 kmph. The 5.2-litre engine of the car produces 572 hp and generates 540 Nm torque.

headline: Tesla drops 'Motors' from its name
body: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla Motors dropped the word 'Motors' from its name on Wednesday. This comes after Tesla acquired solar panel-making company SolarCity in a deal worth $2 billion last year. Earlier, Musk also revealed a plan to start a service where Tesla car owners can rent their cars out when they're not in use.

headline: Dutch university's pod wins Musk's Hyperloop competition
body: Travel pod named 'Delft Hyperloop' made by students from the Netherlands-based Delft University of Technology has won Hyperloop's first ever competition organised by Elon Musk's space company SpaceX. The pod passed the safety and design tests and reached a speed of 94 kmph at the final run of the competition. A total of 29 teams took part in the competition.

headline: General Motors to give bonuses up to ₹8L to 52,000 workers
body: American vehicle manufacturer General Motors' 52,000 hourly workers will receive bonuses of up to ₹8 lakh after the company registered a record year in 2016, including around ₹80,770 crore profit in North America. The General Motors' profit-sharing bonuses are the biggest given by the company to date. General Motors' trucks and SUV sales drove the profits in its home market.

headline: How is the ₹17 crore worth Bugatti Chiron supercar made?
body: One of the fastest production supercars in the world, French luxury carmaker Bugatti's ₹17 crore worth Chiron supercar is assembled at the company's factory in Molsheim, France. Each Chiron takes about six months, 20 people, and 1,800 parts for production, and no robot is involved in the process. Chiron can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in under 2.5 seconds.

headline: Ambassador car brand sold to Peugeot for ₹80 crore
body: Kolkata-based automaker Hindustan Motors on Friday sold the iconic Ambassador car brand to French car manufacturer Peugeot in a deal worth ₹80 crore. Hindustan Motors began manufacturing the Ambassador car in 1958, which was also used by several Prime Ministers. The production of the car stopped nearly three years ago in May 2014.

headline: Tesla beats own record for fastest electric car acceleration
body: In a new track test, Tesla's Model S car accelerated from 0-100 kmph in 2.275 seconds using the recently-updated 'Ludicrous+' mode. Tesla's fastest production electric car beat its own record time of 2.389 seconds. The car was previously recorded as being quicker than Faraday Future's FF 91 by just a thousandth of a second.

headline: Ford puts $1 billion in startup by ex-Uber, Google engineers
body: American automaker Ford has announced an investment of $1 billion in tech startup Argo AI, founded by former Google and Uber engineers. Ford will acquire a majority stake in the startup, which will focus on developing software platform for Ford's self-driving car. In August, Ford said it will mass-produce fully self-driving cars without brake pedals and steering wheels by 2021.

headline: Tata Motors to launch sportscar under new sub-brand 'Tamo'
body: Tata Motors on Thursday launched its new sub-brand 'Tamo' under which the company will premiere its first supercar 'Futuro'. The supercar will premiere at the upcoming 87th Geneva International Motor Show on March 7, 2017. Tata Motors said Tamo will act as an incubating centre of innovation towards new technologies, business models and partnerships.

headline: Faraday Future will only build 2 cars from the planned 7
body: Electric car startup Faraday Future is scaling back plans to build vehicles in the US and has reportedly slashed its planned car portfolio from seven to two. Its upcoming $1 billion factory has also been downsized to a quarter of the original size. Faraday Future, which is pitted against Tesla, has lost over 10 key executives in 9 months.

headline: Musk calls claims of low wages at Tesla 'morally outrageous'
body: Tesla's Elon Musk has called a factory worker's claims that pay at Tesla is among the lowest in automotive industry "morally outrageous". Musk added that the man "doesn't really work" for Tesla, but has been paid by a union organisation to agitate for a union. The worker called Tesla "a company of the future with working conditions of the past".

headline: Jaguar Land Rover engines worth ₹24 cr stolen from UK plant
body: Over $3.7 million (₹24 crore) worth of Jaguar Land Rover engines were stolen from the company's factory in Solihull, England this week. The thieves reportedly hooked a trailer full of engines to a stolen truck and drove off. The same factory witnessed a similar theft three years ago, in which the engines taken were worth $1.2 million (₹8 crore).

headline: Musk joins Trump manufacturing council with Dell, Ford CEOs
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been appointed to US President Donald Trump's manufacturing council, led by Dow Chemical CEO Andrew Liveris. Other members of the council include Intel CEO Brian Krzanich, Dell CEO and Founder Michael Dell, and Ford CEO Mark Fields. Musk is also part of Trump's Strategic and Policy Forum, which advises on economic matters.

headline: Elon Musk explains what Tesla, SpaceX logos mean
body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in a recent tweet explained what the logos of the companies, which manufacture electric cars and reusable rockets respectively, mean. Tesla's stylised 'T' logo is intended to represent the cross-section of an electric motor, Musk said. The extended 'X' in SpaceX's logo symbolises a rocket's trajectory.

headline: Ford makes car parts from tomatoes and Coca-Cola bottles
body: As a part of its biomaterials research, American automaker Ford is making car parts from shredded cash, leftover tomato parts and Coca-Cola bottles. Ford is also using plants like bamboo, wheat, rice hulls and coconut skins to make reliable car parts. Soybean-based foam developed by Ford is being used in every seat cushion of its cars.

headline: Ford could lose ₹4,000 crore due to Brexit, warns Executive
body: Ford Europe CEO Jim Farley has warned that the slump in the value of pound since Brexit could cost the automaker around $600 million (over ₹4,000 crore) this year. Ford makes 20 lakh engines in the UK and employs 15,000 staff, Farley said. In this regard, the company will have a lot of work to do in 2017, he added.

headline: Adidas files complaint against Tesla Model 3's old logo
body: Sportswear manufacturer Adidas has filed a legal challenge against carmaker Tesla's old logo for its upcoming Model 3 cars. Adidas claims that the three horizontal bars used by Tesla resemble its 3-Stripes trademark and will "cause confusion" between the brands. However, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed the company will use the numeric '3' instead of stripes as the logo.

headline: Honda recalls over 40,000 cars in India over faulty airbags
body: Honda on Tuesday recalled 41,580 units of its Accord, Civic, City and Jazz models in India which were made in 2012 to replace faulty airbags. This takes the overall number of vehicles recalled by Honda in India with Takata-manufactured airbags to around 3 lakh. Japan-based Takata's exploding airbags have been linked to at least 17 deaths worldwide.

headline: Rolls-Royce ends 13-year run of Phantom VII
body: British luxury carmaker Rolls-Royce announced that it has built the last unit of its seventh generation Phantom car after a 13-year run. The 'Blue Velvet' car has a nautical theme with white lines on the tyres and a ship motif on the coach lines. It sports a V12 engine which offers 453 bhp and a top speed of 240 kmph.

headline: Tesla will hopefully launch in India this summer: Elon Musk
body: Electric automobile maker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday responded to a user's query on Twitter about the company's plans to launch its cars in India with, "Hoping for summer this year." Tesla had opened pre-orders for its Model 3 cars in India last year. Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari had also asked Tesla to make India its Asia manufacturing hub.

headline: Online automobile marketplace CarTrade raises ₹370 crore
body: Online automobile classifieds portal CarTrade on Wednesday announced that it has raised about ₹370 crore ($55 million) in a funding round led by Temasek Holdings and a US-based family office. Temasek, which is a government-owned investment firm from Singapore, had led a ₹950 crore funding round in CarTrade in January 2016. CarTrade also provides automobile reviews, on-road prices, and comparisons.

headline: Man seeks NGT nod to ply 20-yr-old Rolls-Royce car in Delhi
body: The owner of a 20-year-old Rolls-Royce car, Delhi resident Ashok Kumar Jain, has approached the National Green Tribunal (NGT) for its approval to let him ply his car in the city. The NGT banned plying of 15-year-old petrol vehicles in 2014. Jain says that he bought the car in 1995 for ₹1 crore and has the requisite pollution test certificate.

headline: Ex-Hyperloop Co-founder begins new high-speed travel startup
body: The former Co-founder and CTO of Hyperloop One, Brogan BamBrogan, has started a new venture named 'Arrivo' that will build a 21st-century high-speed transportation system for passengers and freight. The new venture's technology will be based on the Hyperloop architecture. BamBrogan had quit Hyperloop last year and sued the company of harassment and violation of the labour laws.

headline: GM uses codenames like 'Cheetah', 'Penguin' for cars
body: In a report on its driverless cars, General Motors revealed it uses codenames like Penguin, Cheetah and Iron Man for each self-driving car being tested. Chevrolet Bolts are named after animals, while Nissan Leafs are named after Marvel Comics characters. The codenames make it easier to identify the electric vehicles in the garage since all of them are white.

headline: Musk shares video of MIT's Hyperloop run in vacuum tube
body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has shared a video of MIT's entry to SpaceX's first-ever Hyperloop competition in which teams built pods to travel inside a 1.5-km long tube. "Air has been removed from the Hyperloop tube to almost vacuum conditions," Musk captioned the video. MIT Hyperloop won the Safety and Reliability award at the competition.

headline: I get to shape buyer perception: Škoda India Sales Director
body: Ashutosh Dixit, Director of Sales and Marketing of Czech automaker Škoda's Indian subsidiary, in a recent interview said that he loves his job as he gets to "shape consumer perception for the brand in India." He added that the volatility and hyper-sensitivity of the Indian automotive market make his life "difficult."

headline: South Korea to develop train that travels up to 1,000 kmph
body: South Korea is planning to develop a high-speed train system in the next three years, aimed to travel at speeds of up to 1,000 kmph. Based on a hyper-tube technology, that propels floating pod-like vehicles through tubes under partial vacuum, the train will travel from Seoul to Busan in half an hour, instead of the current time of three hours.

headline: Girnar Software to fire 136 employees to cut costs
body: Consumer internet firm Girnar Software, which runs auto portals like CarDekho, Gaadi, and Zigwheels, is firing 136 employees as part of restructuring exercise to cut costs. The exercise is aimed at becoming profitable by first quarter of next fiscal, as promised to the board. Employees with structurally negative unit economics were identified for job cut, said company's CEO Amit Jain.

headline: Mahindra Marine unveils new luxury yacht
body: Mahindra Marine has unveiled the Mahindra Odyssea 55, its new flagship yacht. The 55-feet-long luxury yacht, which features a saloon and master cabin with a personal bar area, can travel at speeds of up to 48 kmph. "Our flagship Mahindra Odyssea 55 series, built to suit Indian conditions, embodies 'Make in India' in its true form", CEO Hiten Ghelani said.

headline: Anand Mahindra trolls Twitter user who asked him to buy car
body: Mahindra Group's Executive Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday trolled a user who asked Mahindra to buy Pininfarina Maserati Birdcage car, picture of which he shared on Twitter. "That's one cage I wouldn't mind being imprisoned in", tweeted Mahindra, to which a user replied, "What stops you from buying it? Go for it". "We bought the company instead....(Pininfarina)," Mahindra tweeted back.

headline: Firm stops making fastest car to reach 0-300 kmph in 13.61s
body: Hennessey Performance Engineering has announced the final Venom GT, which is the Guinness record holder for the fastest car to accelerate from 0-300 kmph in 13.61 seconds. Powered by a 7-litre V8 engine, the 1,451 bhp Venom GT Final Edition will be finished with "glacier blue" paint and white stripes. The car has been priced at $1.2 million (₹8 crore).

headline: Nissan makes largest-ever map of India to mark Republic Day
body: Nissan India is set to enter the Limca Book of Records after it made the largest-ever outline of India's map to commemorate the country's 68th Republic Day. A Nissan GT-R sports car carved out the approximate map of India on Sambhar Lake's dry surface in Rajasthan. The map covers a 3-kilometre-square area with a perimeter of 14.7 km.

headline: Nothing more British than Tata's Jaguar Land Rover: UK PM
body: UK PM Theresa May said that even though the country's biggest manufacturer Tata is Indian, there cannot be anything more British than its Jaguar Land Rover. Speaking at the World Economic Forum, she said Britain would be open for trade even after leaving the European Union. May further said that Britain has started talks for stronger trade pacts with India.

headline: DC Design enters two-wheeler segment with Bullet 350
body: Indian automobile customisation firm DC Design has entered the two-wheeler segment with its sub-brand DC2 by launching styling kit 'Carbon-Shot' for Royal Enfield Bullet 350. Priced at ₹76,000, the kit includes all-LED headlamp and front indicators in billet casing, along with leather and steel rider seat. Other features include carbon rear fender and micro fender and billet fuel tank cover.

headline: Faraday Future sued for ₹12.2 crore over unpaid dues
body: Electric carmaker and Tesla rival Faraday Future has been sued for ₹12.2 crore by visual effects studio The Mill Group over unpaid dues. The studio, which made a graphical presentation of the startup's first car FF 91, alleges it received only ₹13 lakh from Faraday against the agreed ₹12.42 crore. Faraday's payment to the company was due in October 2016.

headline: Driver in fatal Tesla crash had 7 secs to react, says report
body: The driver killed in a car crash last year while Tesla's Autopilot was active had at least seven seconds to take action before impact, claims a recently concluded investigation by the US government. Even though the tractor trailer had been visible to the driver, he "took no braking, steering, or other actions," added the report.

headline: World's longest range electric car travels 539 km per charge
body: Elon Musk-led carmaker Tesla's Model S has become the world's longest range electric car that travels up to 539 kilometres on a single charge. This comes after adding a '100D' battery pack, giving the car an extra range of 32 kilometres. The Model S 100D still hits 250 kmph top speed and goes from 0-100 kmph in 4.2 seconds.

headline: Chinese man wheelies 20.8 kilometres in 46 minutes
body: Chinese stunt driver Han Yue recently set the Guinness World Record for the 'fastest side wheelie lap of the Nürburgring Nordschleife in a car' by completing the lap in 45 minutes and 59.11 seconds. Driving a red Mini Cooper, Yue navigated 73 turns, spanning 20.8 kilometres, without letting the car's right wheels touch the ground.

headline: US President Donald Trump meets Ford, General Motors CEOs
body: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday met the CEOs of country's three major automakers namely Ford, General Motors and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles. Noting pollution regulations are “out of control”, Trump said he believes he can cut regulations "by 75% or maybe more". He also assured the government will reduce taxes so that cars sold in the US are built locally.

headline: Which cars does US President-elect Donald Trump own?
body: Donald Trump, who is set to be sworn in as the 45th President of the United States on Friday, owns a number of luxury cars. Trump owns a Rolls-Royce Phantom, a vintage 1956 Rolls-Royce Silver Cloud and a Mercedes-Benz SLR. He also owned a Lamborghini Diablo sports car, which he sold on eBay in 2016.

headline: Tesla sues ex-Autopilot Director over stolen company secrets
body: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla has sued former Director of its driver-assist technology Autopilot, Sterling Anderson, accusing him of stealing the company's secret information. Tesla accused Anderson of trying to recruit at least a dozen former Tesla colleagues and build a new car startup. Anderson started working on his new autonomous-car venture Aurora Innovation in 2016.

headline: Video shows evolution of Range Rover SUV from 1969 to 2017
body: Land Rover created the first prototype for the iconic Range Rover in 1969 under the name 'Velar'. In 1973, Range Rover got its recognisable floating roof, the four-door body was introduced in 1981 and the car became world's first all-aluminium SUV in 2012. In its latest rendition, the SVAutobiography Dynamic 2017 features the most powerful engine in Range Rover’s history.

headline: Chinese car owners set record for biggest Tesla parade
body: Tesla Model S and Model X car owners in China recently set a record for the largest parade of Tesla cars. Over a hundred Model X SUVs also formed a giant X as part of the presentation. The Model X cars performed the Christmas light show easter egg that Tesla had released in December as part of an update.

headline: Most expensive US house for sale has 12 cars, 10 motorbikes
body: The most expensive house listed in the US for ₹1,703 crore ($250 million) includes 10 motorcycles, 12 cars and a helicopter. The cars in the mansion include Rolls-Royce Dawn, Ferrari 488, and two of the most expensive cars in the collection, a Pagani Huayra, and a 1936 Mercedes-Benz 540K. While Pagani costs around ₹13 crore, Mercedes costs over ₹102 crore.

headline: Tesla knew drivers would misuse Autopilot, reveals US govt
body: According to a report released by the US government, electric carmaker Tesla knew that drivers would misuse its semi-autonomous Autopilot mode and tested all possible scenarios. "Tesla considered that drivers might fail to pay attention, fall asleep, or become incapacitated," said the report. Tesla has been cleared of any fault in a fatal accident involving its Autopilot system last year.

headline: Will benefit from Trump policy on Mexico imports, says Ford
body: Ford Motor expressed optimism about US President Donald Trump's policies, saying it could be one of the main beneficiaries of possible tariffs on imports from Mexico. The US automaker's CEO Mark Fields said Trump’s first steps since taking office had been positive. “He’s focused on driving policy that drives investment and job creation in manufacturing and automotive manufacturing,” Fields added.

headline: Toyota planning to launch India-specific hybrid car in 5 yrs
body: Toyota is planning to launch an India-specific model focusing on hybrid technology in five years, according to a top official. The car will comply with India’s Corporate Average Fuel Economy (CAFE) norms, to ensure that mileage of cars improves by 10% between 2017 and 2021, and 30% from 2022. Further, carbon dioxide emissions shall reduce to 108 grams/litre starting 2022.

headline: Okinawa launches electric scooter in India at ₹43,700
body: Gurugram-based automobile company Okinawa Autotech on Monday launched electric scooter 'Ridge' in India at ₹43,700 (ex-showroom, Delhi). The zero emission vehicle clocks speeds of over 55 kmph and features anti-theft alarm, central locking smart controller and Eco and Power mode options. The vehicle claims to travel for up to 90 kilometres on a single charge.

headline: Company teases electric supercar that resembles a flower
body: Vanda Electrics has teased the all-electric Dendrobium, which is named after a type of orchid native to Singapore, as the car's automatic roof and doors resemble the flower's petals as they open. Dendrobium is considered to be Singapore's first home-grown supercar. The car is expected to have 1,500 horsepower and a 0-100 kmph time of about 2.6 seconds.

headline: Ford launches brand to sell auto parts for rivals' vehicles
body: American automaker has launched Omnicraft, its first new Customer Service Division brand in 50 years, which will sell parts to fix competitors' vehicles. The division will start selling 1,500 most commonly requested parts from non-Ford auto brands. Ford expects business for automotive parts, which is estimated to be $500 billion currently, to expand by 70% in the next six years.

headline: Electric cars not a game changer for oil demand: Oil firm BP
body: Spencer Dale, Chief Economist of oil company BP, formerly British Petroleum, has said that growth of electric cars will not be a "game changer" for oil industry. "It's not Teslas and the US. It's the fact that 2 billion people, mainly in Asia, are moving to middle income and can buy their first car, that drives oil demand," he said.

headline: AirAsia denies ₹21 crore link in Rolls-Royce bribery scandal
body: Malaysia-based AirAsia has denied any connection to the corruption scandal surrounding Rolls-Royce, which reportedly paid bribes to win contracts. After its largest graft probe, Britain's Serious Fraud Office alleged Rolls-Royce bribed an AirAsia executive with credits worth $3.2 million (₹21.8 crore). This financial advantage was given for favouring Rolls-Royce in purchase of products, it added.

headline: Tata Motors launches hybrid, electric buses at ₹2 crore
body: Tata Motors on Tuesday launched its Starbus brand of fully electric and hybrid buses with prices ranging between ₹1.6 crore and ₹2 crore. The company also unveiled India's first hydrogen-powered fuel cell bus developed in partnership with ISRO (Indian Space Research Organisation). The bus produces electricity using hydrogen and oxygen with only water and heat as a byproduct.

headline: Ducati launches India's most expensive bike at ₹1.12 crore
body: Audi-owned motorcycle manufacturer Ducati has launched India's most expensive production bike, the 1299 Superleggera, at ₹1.12 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi). Ducati claims the 1,285 cc bike has the most powerful twin-cylinder ever produced, which delivers 215 horsepower with 146.5 Nm of torque. Only 500 units of the 1299 Superleggera will be offered globally.

headline: Tesla beats world's fastest electric car by 0.001 second
body: Tesla's latest update 'Ludicrous Plus mode' to its Tesla S model made the car accelerate from 0-100 kmph in only 2.389 seconds. This beat the world's fastest production electric car Faraday Future's FF 91 record of 2.39 seconds by just a thousandth of a second. Earlier, Tesla Co-founder Elon Musk tweeted that even 2.34 seconds is achievable by the company.

headline: Mercedes-Benz is the leading luxury car brand in India
body: India’s leading luxury car brand Mercedes-Benz sold over 13,000 units for the second year in a row despite demonetisation and diesel ban for eight months in Delhi-NCR in 2016. “This was the most successful year for Mercedes-Benz in the history of the company,” Mercedes-Benz spokesperson said. The SUV range grew by more than 20% with GLE being the most sold.

headline: US should make better cars: Germany responds to Trump threat
body: German Vice Chancellor Sigmar Gabriel has said US should "build better cars" when asked what Donald Trump could do to make sure German customers bought more American cars. Trump had earlier threatened to hike taxes for cars produced outside the US. "The tax would make the US car industry weaker, worse and more expensive," Gabriel added.

headline: US environment agency accuses Fiat of cheating emission test
body: The US Environmental Protection Agency on Thursday accused Fiat Chrysler Automobiles of using a software that allowed excess diesel emissions in over one lakh trucks and SUVs sold since 2014. Fiat, however, dismissed the accusations claiming that its software was "properly justified". The allegations against Fiat came after a probe that stemmed from EPA investigation of automaker Volkswagen.

headline: Volkswagen to pay $4.3 bn fine to US over diesel emissions
body: German automaker Volkswagen has agreed to pay $4.3 billion in fine to the United States for making its diesel cars cheat in pollution emission tests. The fine brings the total amount paid by Volkswagen for cheating the tests to at least $19 billion. Volkswagen admitted having installed the software in 11 million cars worldwide to fake emission tests.

headline: Volkswagen to recall 3L cars in India over emissions scandal
body: German automaker Volkswagen will recall nearly 3.43 lakh diesel cars across 13 models in India as a part of a global recall to replace a software that helped vehicles fake pollution emission tests. The models to be recalled include Polo, Vento, Jetta, Audi A4 and A6 among others. Volkswagen has paid over $19 billion in fines for cheating emission tests.

headline: Man stranded as Tesla lock refuses to open with smartphone
body: A man named Ryan Negri was stranded at Red Rock Canyon on Sunday after his Tesla car's smart lock refused to open using his phone. Negri claimed the lock didn't open as the phone was unable to catch a signal. Negri's wife ran three kilometres after which her phone received a signal and she got the car's key from home.

headline: Vin Diesel welcomed to India by women on Royal Enfield bikes
body: Hollywood actor Vin Diesel and Deepika Padukone were welcomed to Mumbai this week by a group of women riding Royal Enfield motorcycles. The women wore traditional Maharashtrian sarees in red with yellow turbans and boots. The ladies also applied 'tilak' on Diesel's forehead as Marathi folk music played in the background.

headline: Volkswagen warns senior execs not to travel to US: Reports
body: Senior Volkswagen managers have reportedly been warned not to travel to the United States after six current and former executives were charged for their role in the German carmaker's diesel test-cheating scheme. "One doesn't need to test the limits," a legal adviser said. German citizens can be extradited only to other European Union countries or to an international court.

headline: President unveils Subhas Chandra Bose's restored car
body: President Pranab Mukherjee on Wednesday unveiled the restored car in which Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose escaped house arrest in 1941. Netaji reportedly travelled from his Kolkata residence to Gomoh railway station in Jharkhand to catch a train to Delhi in the car. The Wanderer W24 Sedan has been restored by Audi to mark the 76th anniversary of the escape.

headline: Tesla hires key designer of Apple's new MacBook Pro
body: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla has hired Matt Casebolt, the key designer behind Apple products like MacBook Air, Mac Pro and the latest MacBook Pro. Casebolt has taken over as the Senior Director of Engineering, Closures and Mechanisms at Tesla Motors. Tesla has also hired Apple's Chris Lattner as its Vice President of Autopilot Software.

headline: Modified Tesla Model S goes from 0-100 kmph in 2.1 seconds
body: A modified version of the Tesla's fastest electric car Model S, created for the Electric GT Championship, successfully accelerated from 0-100 kmph in only 2.1 seconds. While Tesla's original Model S accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 2.4 seconds, its rival Faraday Future's FF 91, the world's fastest electric car in production, achieves the same feat in 2.39 seconds.

headline: Trump threatens BMW with 35% border tax on Mexico-built cars
body: US President-elect Donald Trump has warned that the country will impose a 35% border tax on cars that German carmaker BMW plans to build at a new plant in Mexico for US market. It would be "much better" for BMW to build its new factory in the US, he stated. Trump earlier gave similar warnings to other carmakers including Toyota.

headline: Rolls-Royce to pay ₹5,500 crore to settle bribery case
body: British automobile manufacturer Rolls-Royce has agreed to pay £671 million (over ₹5,500 crore) in penalties to authorities in Britain, Brazil and the US to settle bribery and corruption charges. The company was accused of paying bribes to secure high-value contracts in countries around the world. Under the agreement, Rolls-Royce will avoid being prosecuted, though executives may still be charged.

headline: Tesla allows self-driving cars to break speed limit
body: Electric car manufacturer Tesla has rolled back a function that limited the speed of its cars in Autopilot mode according to traffic rules. Users will be able to set the speed limit of their self-driving cars at 8 kmph more than the limit on roads, while the limit for highways can be set up to 145 kmph.

headline: Hyundai to invest ₹21,000 crore in US after Trump's threat
body: Hyundai Motor has said it plans to lift US investment by 50% to $3.1 billion (over ₹21,000 crore) over five years after US President-elect Donald Trump threatened to tax imports. Toyota may also build a new plant in the US. Notably, Trump has warned of a 35% tax on vehicles imported from Mexico amid attempts to revive US industrial jobs.

headline: BMW India appoints ex-Harley-Davidson India MD as President
body: BMW has appointed former Harley-Davidson India MD Vikram Pawah as the President of its India operations. Pawah has previously worked with Honda Cars in India and Australia as the Assistant Vice President and Operating Head of Sales. Current acting President Frank Schloeder will assume the position of Head of Business Steering - Luxury Class in Germany.

headline: Musk hints update to make Tesla Model S fastest electric car
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday tweeted about an update to make Tesla Model S world's fastest production electric car by accelerating from 0-100 kmph in 2.42 seconds. This would make the cars 0.05 seconds faster than rival Faraday Future's recently unveiled 'FF91'. Responding to Musk's tweet, Faraday Future said, "We're ready to work together to elevate the electric industry."

headline: Tata to conduct India's first self-driving car test: Reports
body: Tata Elxsi, a design firm part of the Tata group, will reportedly become the first company to test self-driving cars in India. The company is said to have sought permission to test re-engineered sedans equipped with ultrasonic sensors and LIDAR radars in Bengaluru. Tata Elxsi is not building its own autonomous cars, but working on software for other carmakers.

headline: Ex-Volkswagen CEO refuses to say when he knew of diesel row
body: Former Volkswagen CEO Martin Winterkorn on Thursday declined to tell German lawmakers when he first learned about the automaker's emissions scandal. On being asked whether he had known about software cheating earlier, he said, "That is not the case." Earlier, Volkswagen agreed to pay the largest ever US criminal fine levied on an automaker for cheating diesel emission tests.

headline: Ex-Rolls-Royce CEO might lose knighthood over bribery case
body: The Opposition party in Britain has called for Sir John Rose, the former CEO of Rolls-Royce, to lose his knighthood after the company admitted to charges of bribery and corruption during his tenure. Earlier this week, the automobile manufacturer agreed to pay £671 million (over ₹5,500 crore) in penalties to authorities in Britain, Brazil and the US.

headline: Luxury yacht concept with sofas, AC and bathroom unveiled
body: The luxury vehicle division of Japanese car maker Toyota, Lexus has unveiled an eight-seater yacht concept that comes with a refrigerator, sofas, air conditioning and a bathroom fitted with a shower. The yacht is powered by a pair of V8 engines that churn out 880 horsepower to deliver a top speed of 79 kmph. It has a see-through engine compartment.

headline: Tesla hires senior Apple executive for Autopilot technology
body: Electric carmaker Tesla has hired Apple's Senior Director and Architect Chris Lattner as its Vice President of Autopilot software. During his 11-year stint at Apple, Lattner led the creation of Swift, the programming language for building apps on Apple platforms. Tesla claims Autopilot is a full self-driving capability at a safety level substantially greater than that of a human.

headline: Chevrolet unveils life-size Batmobile made of Lego bricks
body: American automaker Chevrolet has unveiled a life-size model of Batmobile made of Lego pieces at the ongoing Detroit Auto Show. The 17-feet long and nearly 7-feet tall Batmobile was made using 3,44,187 individual Lego bricks of 17 different colours. It took 222 hours to design the car and 1,833 hours to put the Lego pieces together.

headline: Self-driving shuttle offers free rides to users in Las Vegas
body: French vehicle manufacturer Navya has started a trial of its self-driving shuttle in Las Vegas, US and is offering free rides to commuters. The 12-seater vehicle has a top speed of about 43.4 kmph but will be restricted to 19 kmph during the trial. The full-scale shuttle service is expected to cost Las Vegas approximately ₹6.8 lakh per month.

headline: France opens probe into emissions test cheating by Renault
body: Paris prosecutors have opened a preliminary probe into possible cheating on exhaust emissions by French automobile maker Renault. Shares of the company dropped by 6% in Paris trading, wiping $1.6 billion off its market value. Stemming from the Volkswagen probe, Fiat Chrysler has also been accused of using a computer software to cheat emission tests of its diesel models.

headline: Fiat concept car has selfie camera, 10 phone chargers
body: Fiat Chrysler has revealed 'Portal', an electric concept car with double-sliding doors, ten docking stations to charge smartphones or tablets, and a selfie camera. Portal, which claims a range of over 400 km, will be able to operate semi-autonomously. It also has an internal intercom and a display at the back to encourage riders to post about their trip.

headline: World's fastest electric car goes from 0-100kmph in 2.39 sec
body: American startup Faraday Future on Wednesday unveiled the 'FF 91', which it claims is the world's fastest production electric vehicle that accelerates from 0-100 kmph in just 2.39 seconds and generates 1050 horsepower. Expected to launch in 2018, the fully self-driving car can travel about 608 km on a single charge and has facial recognition technology that allows keyless entry.

headline: World's fastest 4-seat car goes from 0-100 kmph in 3.5 sec
body: British luxury carmaker Bentley on Friday unveiled the world's fastest four-seat car, the 2017 Continental Supersports which can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in 3.5 seconds and has a top speed of 336 kmph. The car is also Bentley's fastest and most powerful production model to date and can cover the length of a football field in a second.

headline: Mercedes beats BMW after a decade as biggest luxury carmaker
body: Automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz became the world’s biggest luxury-car brand in 2016, marking the end of rival BMW's more than a decade-old success run. Mercedes-Benz sold around 80,000 more units of its vehicles than BMW all over the world last year to reach the top spot. Further, German carmaker Audi stood at the third spot during this period.

headline: Make in USA or pay big tax, Trump tells General Motors
body: US President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday threatened to impose a hefty tariff on General Motors if the Detroit-based company does not manufacture its automobiles in the country. "General Motors is sending Mexican made models of Chevy Cruze to US car dealers-tax free across the border. Make in USA or pay big border tax!", tweeted Trump.

headline: Hot Yoga founder Bikram Choudhury's 43 luxury cars missing
body: Hot Yoga founder Bikram Choudhury owned 43 luxury cars that have gone missing after he lost a sexual harassment case filed by his former legal adviser Minakshi Jafa-Bodden. A US court directed Choudhury to give up the cars, which included 13 Rolls-Royces and eight Bentleys, to Minakshi. He was also ordered to give up his income to pay for damages.

headline: I don't think driverless cars will come to India: Pichai
body: Citing a recent statement by Uber CEO Travis Kalanick that India will be the last country to get driverless cars, Google CEO Sundar Pichai has said, "I don't think for a country like India you are gonna see, as Travis said, completely automated cars." However, he added that using cars as a shared resource will benefit India greatly.

headline: Toyota's concept car alerts other drivers of upcoming turns
body: Japanese automaker Toyota has unveiled a new concept of self-driving car called 'Concept-i', that notifies the cars driving behind it about upcoming road hazards or turns through an exterior LED lighting system. It also greets both the driver and the passengers approaching towards it. The car's integrated with a virtual companion 'Yui' that learns the driver's behaviour and driving pattern.

headline: Ford cancels ₹10,000 crore plant after Trump's criticism
body: US automaker Ford's CEO Mark Fields on Tuesday announced that the company is scrapping plans to build a ₹10,900-crore small car production plant in Mexico. This comes after US President-elect Donald Trump criticised Ford for shifting jobs out of the US. Ford, USA's second largest automaker, had planned to shift production to Mexico to cut costs amid declining car sales.

headline: Volkswagen concept 8-seater travels 480 km in 30 min charge
body: Volkswagen on Monday unveiled ID Buzz, an eight-seater electric minivan with a range of 600 km which can charge up to 80% in 30 minutes. The steering wheel of the self-driving minivan retracts into the cockpit and the driver's seat can be turned around to face the passengers in the back. ID Buzz is Volkswagen's first fully autonomous concept car.

headline: Automobile sales growth at 16-year-low after demonetisation
body: Monthly growth rate of automobile sales in India slipped to a 16-year-low in December 2016, reflecting the negative consumer sentiment in the market due to demonetisation, said SIAM Director General Vishnu Mathur. Total vehicle sales declined by 18.66% from a year ago period. Sales of two-wheelers also witnessed the steepest ever decline of 22.04% in December 2016.

headline: Hyundai concept car also acts as air conditioner for houses
body: Hyundai has revealed a "Mobility Vision" concept that shows an autonomous car docking into the interior of a smart home. As part of the living space, the car can act as an air conditioner, share its entertainment facilities by connecting with the home's devices and even provide power in emergency situations by using its onboard fuel cell as a generator.

headline: Woman sues Uber, Honda after being paralysed in car crash
body: An American woman has sued Uber and Honda after the driver of her Uber cab jumped a red light, leading to a crash that left her paralysed from the chest down. The suit alleges security lapse on Uber's part for ignoring previous drug and gambling charges against the driver. The owner of the Honda-branded taxi has also been sued.

headline: In pics: Hi-tech cars at world's largest electronics show
body: A range of hi-technology cars was showcased at the world's largest consumer electronics show CES held in Las Vegas from January 5-8 this year. Startup Faraday Future unveiled the 'FF 91', the world's fastest production electric vehicle that accelerates from 0-100 kmph in just 2.39 seconds. Hyundai revealed a self-driving car concept that also acts an air conditioner for houses.

headline: Electric scooter that can charge 5 devices together made
body: A US-based startup has developed a foldable electric scooter 'URB-E Sport' which can charge up to five devices simultaneously. The scooter's battery can charge an Apple MacBook five times or an iPhone 40 times over. Priced at about ₹61,000, the scooter has a range of 25.7 km on a single charge and a top speed of 22.5 km.

headline: Japan defends Toyota after Trump threat on Mexico-built cars
body: The Japanese government defended Toyota Motor as an "important corporate citizen" of the US, after President-elect Donald Trump threatened to impose punitive tariffs on its Mexico-built cars. "Toyota Motor said will build a new plant in...Mexico to build Corolla cars for US. NO WAY! Build plant in US or pay big border tax," Trump said in a post on Twitter.

headline: Samsung car battery gives 600km of travel in 20 min charge
body: South Korean technology major Samsung's lithium ion and renewable division, Samsung SDI, has developed a new electric vehicle battery that claims to give 600 kilometres of travel after just 20 minutes of charging. This range is higher than 426 kilometres, the current range offered by a fully charged Model S car manufactured by Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla.

headline: Honda unveils self-balancing bike that follows its owner
body: Honda has unveiled its Moto Riding Assist technology to make a motorcycle capable of balancing itself when at rest. The front wheel of the bike twitches back and forth to keep it upright. A video shared by Honda also shows the motorcycle driving itself to follow its owner at a slow pace.

headline: Google's first self-driving minivans to ride on public roads
body: Waymo, the self-driving startup spun-off from Google last year, will be deploying its fully self-driving fleet of minivans made with Fiat Chrysler on public roads for the first time later this month. The minivans will be deployed in California and Arizona's Phoenix. All the self-driving technology including cameras, sensors, and mapping has been developed in-house by Waymo.

headline: Pakistan Court issues arrest warrant against Wasim Akram
body: A Karachi court on Tuesday issued bailable arrest warrant against former cricketer Wasim Akram after he failed to appear before the court during the last 31 hearings of a case. Akram had lodged the case himself in August last year after his Mercedes was shot at in Karachi. Akram has been asked to appear before the court on January 17.

headline: BMW's car concept lets each passenger listen to own music
body: Automotive major BMW has revealed a concept depicting the interior of a futuristic self-driving car with "Sound Curtains" that allow each passenger to play their own music without the need for headphones. The music is played through a component at the head of each seat. The model also features BMW's HoloActive floating touchscreen with navigation and entertainment functions.

headline: Faraday Future car's self-parking fails during launch event
body: American startup Faraday Future, which unveiled world's fastest production electric car FF 91, failed to get the car park itself with a button press following a technical glitch during launch. The car failed to move when company's investor and LeEco Founder Jia Yueting pressed the self-parking button. "It's a little bit crazy," said an executive after the failed attempt.

headline: Honda's self-driving car concept lets owners earn money
body: Japanese carmaker Honda on Friday unveiled an electric self-driving car concept called 'NeuV' that uses artificial intelligence to understand owners' emotions and also helps them earn money via ride-sharing. NeuV is designed to operate as a part of a self-driving ride-fleet, letting owners generate revenue from their vehicles when they're not in use.

headline: Few Mexican-made Chevy Cruze sold in US: GM on Trump's tweet
body: After United States President-elect Donald Trump threatened to impose hefty tariff on General Motors (GM), the automaker said only a small number of Mexican-made Chevrolet Cruze models are sold in US. Trump had alleged that GM sends Mexican-made models of Cruze to American car dealers tax-free across the border. "Make in USA or pay big border tax," Trump's tweet read.

headline: Mercedes self-driving cars to rival Tesla's Autopilot system
body: Mercedes' self-driving E-Class cars, which are expected to compete with Tesla's Autopilot system, have been granted a test license for autonomous driving in the US. The Drive Pilot technology by Mercedes will maintain the car's speed and keep it within its lane. It will request a driver response every 10 seconds, depending on current road conditions.

headline: Logo on Nissan's concept car lights up in self-driving mode
body: Nissan on Monday unveiled the 'Vmotion 2.0' concept car whose logo on the front grille and rear diffuser will glow when the car operates in self-driving mode. The front and rear doors of the sedan swing outward to open. The headrests of the car's seats feature Bose speakers that can control the direction and distance of sound.

headline: Nissan's self-driving cars to use NASA's Mars Rover tech
body: Nissan has said its autonomous cars will use the Seamless Autonomous Mobility technology built by NASA for the Mars Rover. On facing an uncertain situation, the vehicle will park itself in a safe spot and request help from a command centre. A human assistant will assess the situation and "paint" a virtual lane for the car to drive itself through.

headline: Actor suing us using celebrity status to hurt company: Tesla
body: Responding to South Korean celebrity Ji Chang Son's lawsuit, electric vehicle maker Tesla said that before filing the lawsuit the actor threatened to use his celebrity status to hurt the company. The actor claims that a Tesla Model X suddenly accelerated during parking, and rammed through his living room causing injuries to him and his son.

headline: Volvo launches 'Red Key' that limits car's top speed
body: Swedish carmaker Volvo has launched a 'Red Key' that restricts the car's top speed to 120 kmph and makes the adaptive cruise control maintain maximum distance from the car in front. The maximum volume of the audio is also reduced and features like distance alert and traffic sign recognition are permanently activated when the car is driven with Red Key.

headline: Google reveals the most searched carmakers in 2016
body: Google has revealed the world's most searched carmakers in the year 2016, with Japan's Honda topping the list and its Civic being the most popular model on the platform. Germany's Mercedes-Benz and Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla were the second and third most searched carmakers respectively. Lamborghini, Maserati and Rolls-Royce were also among the most searched carmakers.

headline: Automatic brakes saved lives in Berlin truck attack: Reports
body: The truck used to barrel into a Christmas market in Berlin on December 19, killing 12 people, could have reportedly killed more if the vehicle's automatic brakes had not activated. The brakes were reportedly engaged after sensing a collision, stopping it within 250 feet. Automatic brakes have been required in trucks weighing over 3,500 kg since 2012 in Europe.\n

headline: Man sues Tesla after car crashes into his living room
body: A Tesla Model X owner on Friday sued the electric carmaker claiming that his SUV suddenly accelerated while being parked. The man said the spontaneous acceleration caused the car to crash through the garage and into the owner's living room, injuring the driver and a passenger. Tesla calls its Model X "the safest, fastest and most capable" SUV in history.

headline: Emirates receives its first Rolls-Royce powered Airbus A380
body: Dubai-based airline Emirates has received its first Rolls-Royce powered Airbus A380 superjumbo after resolving a dispute with the British engine maker over a technical issue. Rolls-Royce is to supply engines for 50 double-deck Emirates A380 jets in a $9.2 billion deal, which was announced in April 2015. Emirates is the biggest A380 operator, having ordered 142 of the superjumbo jets.

headline: I-T dept asks car dealers for customer list post note ban
body: The I-T department has issued a notice to car dealers across India asking for a list of customers who bought cars after the demonetisation of high-value currency on November 8. These customers would get notices from January 2017, once the list has been examined by the department. Further, car dealers will have to furnish bank account statements for these transactions.

headline: Parents of car crash victim sue Apple over use of FaceTime
body: Parents of a 5-year-old girl who died in a car accident in 2014 have sued Apple for failing to implement a patented technology that could lock out FaceTime to prevent distracted driving. That patent would prevent users from activating or using FaceTime while driving, utilising a motion and scenery analyser to lock out certain features under certain conditions.

headline: Royal Enfield launches Classic 350 Redditch Series at ₹1.46L
body: Royal Enfield has launched its Classic 350 motorcycle in three Redditch series variants – Red, Green and Blue, in India at ₹1.46 lakh (on-road, Delhi). The series is inspired by 1950’s motorcycles manufactured in Redditch, a UK town known as the birthplace of Royal Enfield motorcycles. Powered by a 346cc Twin spark single cylinder engine, the motorcycle produces 19.8 bhp.

headline: Hyundai America fires CEO for not meeting sales goals
body: South Korean car manufacturer Hyundai Motor has fired its America CEO Dave Zuchowski with immediate effect. While the company did not mention the reason for Zuchowski's departure, reports claim that he was sacked over missing the company's internal sales goals. Zuchowski, who earlier worked with Ford and later Mazda, took over as Hyundai's America CEO in 2014.

headline: 19 people sit inside Tesla Model S to attempt world record
body: As many as 19 people stuffed themselves inside a Tesla Model S sedan to attempt the world record for most people in a smart car at one time. People in the car included a kid, who wasn't counted as all participants require to be 18 years and above. The attempt failed as the existing record is set for 20 people.

headline: Global CEO of Faraday Future quits before debut of 1st car
body: Ding Lei, Global CEO of Tesla's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has quit the Chinese-backed, American start-up technology company days before the debut of its first fully electric production car at Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2017. Lei is also a top executive at technology firm LeEco and spearheaded its self-driving electric car project, the LeSEE.

headline: Demonetisation has given a severe blow to us, says Toyota
body: Managing Director of Toyota Kirloskar Motor, the Indian subsidiary of the Japanese automaker, Akito Tachibana has said that demonetisation gave a severe blow to Toyota. There has been a downfall of 30-40% post the decision, he stated. Further, India is the most challenging market in the world and 2016 has been the toughest year in India operations, he added.

headline: Volvo's high-end 90 Series cars to have Skype built in
body: Swedish automaker Volvo has announced that it will integrate Microsoft's Skype into its high-end 90 Series cars. Skype will be accessible through a touchscreen on the dashboard which will display a list of scheduled meetings and a shortcut to the user's complete contact list. Volvo is exploring the use of Microsoft's digital assistant Cortana in its cars, including voice recognition.

headline: Google, Fiat Chrysler working on Android car technology
body: Google and Italian carmaker Fiat Chrysler are working on an Android Nougat-based in-car system technology under Google's newly set up self-driving car company Waymo. The new system called Uconnect, includes an 8.4-inch screen for accessing Android apps and in-car controls like air conditioning, heat, and terrestrial radio. The new technology will be on display at CES in a Chrysler 300.

headline: Taxis to overtake private car sales soon: Maruti's Bhargava
body: Maruti Suzuki Chairman RC Bhargava has said the bulk of future vehicle purchases will be in the taxi space and fewer cars will be bought for personal use. The changing car-buying pattern, however, is unlikely to impact sales, Bhargava said. This is positive, as anything that increases efficiency has to be good for the customer and the industry, he added.

headline: Tesla Autopilot applies brake on anticipating highway crash
body: Dashcam footage from a Tesla Model X in the Netherlands shows the car anticipating an accident on the highway and applying brakes to prevent collision. However, the car in front of the Tesla crashes into an SUV seconds later. Tesla's Autopilot software has a radar processing technology, giving the car the ability to see ahead of the car in front.

headline: Volkswagen teases electric car with foldable steering wheel
body: German automaker Volkswagen has teased a new electric car with self-driving capabilities and a steering wheel that retracts into the 'cockpit'. Volkswagen has called the car, which appears to look like a classic microbus, a "multi-functional vehicle for a new era." The vehicle will debut at the North American International Auto Show in Detroit in January 2017.

headline: Volkswagen buys app to let users pay for parking with phones
body: Volkswagen has acquired Canadian digital payments provider PayByPhone to let users pay for parking with a smartphone. PayByPhone is running a pilot program in London in which license plates are connected with user accounts and the user is automatically charged when they leave a parking lot. In 2015, Volkswagen bought a 92% stake in leading German mobile payments firm SunHill.

headline: Hidden Tesla car feature activates Christmas light show
body: Elon Musk has revealed an Easter egg which has been rolled out with the latest software update for its Model X cars that activates their folding Falcon wing doors, fog lights, headlights and more to put up a Christmas-themed light show. The cars also play a holiday soundtrack in sync with the lights.

headline: Uber launches fleet of electric Tesla cars in Spain
body: Ride-hailing startup Uber has launched a fleet of electric Tesla Model S cars in Madrid, Spain. Uber was banned in the city till March this year and aims to improve its image in the city with the introduction of cleaner cars. The company started trials with fully-electric cars in Portugal and London, earlier this year.

headline: 2 top executives quit Faraday Future before debut of 1st car
body: Tesla's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has reportedly lost two of its top executives, less than a month before the debut of its first production car at Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2017. Marco Mattiacci, Chief Brand and Commercial Officer, and Joerg Sommer, VP for Product Marketing and Growth have been removed from the company's website.\n\n

headline: BMW to recall 1.93 lakh cars in China over faulty airbags
body: German automaker BMW will start recalling over 1.93 lakh cars from August 2017 in China over a defect in their airbags. The cars are being recalled as the gas generators inside the inflating airbags may damage and cause flying debris, posing safety risks to the passengers. BMW has promised to replace the defective airbags free of charge.

headline: New Audi ad shows Barbie doll driving an R8 sports car
body: A new animated advertisement by Audi in Spain aims to tackle gender stereotypes. Titled 'The Doll that Chose to Drive,' the video shows a Barbie doll entering the 'Boys' section of a toy store and driving away in an Audi R8 sports car. The commercial ends with the tagline, 'Let's change the game.'

headline: Panasonic to invest $256 mn in Tesla's solar cell factory
body: Japanese electronics company Panasonic will invest more than $256 million in a New York production facility owned by Elon Musk's Tesla Motors to make solar cells and panels. Following the announcement, Tesla's shares were up by 3.5% on Tuesday. Panasonic is the exclusive supplier of batteries for Tesla's Model S, Model X, and the upcoming Model 3.

headline: What were the most expensive cars launched in India in 2016?
body: The most expensive car launched in India this year is the bullet-proof Mercedes-Maybach S600 Guard. Called the "safest luxury spot on earth" by Mercedes, the car is priced at ₹10.5 crore (ex-showroom Delhi). Other cars on the most expensive list include the Audi A8 L Security limousine and soft-top Rolls-Royce Dawn at ₹9.15 crore and ₹6.25 crore respectively.

headline: Tesla rival Lucid Motors' new car travels 640 km per charge
body: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's rival Lucid Motors on Thursday unveiled its first car called the 'Air' which travels over 640 kilometres on a single charge. Powered by a 100 kWh battery, the luxury sedan accelerates from 0-100 kmph in just 2.5 seconds. Founded by former Tesla and BMW executives, Lucid Motors plans to launch the Air in 2018.

headline: John Abraham gets India's only Nissan GT-R Black Edition
body: Actor and model John Abraham has become the owner of India's only 2017 Nissan GT-R Black Edition car with orange brake calipers and shared a video showing his new ride. The Nissan GT-R was launched earlier this month at ₹1.99 crore for a base model. Powered by a twin-turbo 3.8-litre V6 engine, the car churns out 562 bhp.

headline: BMW launches six-door Mini Clubman in India at ₹37.90 lakh
body: BMW-owned British carmaker Mini has launched its six-door Clubman in India at ₹37.90 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi). Powered by a 2.0-litre turbocharged petrol engine, the Mini Clubman churns out 189 bhp, has a top speed of 228 kmph, and accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 7.2 seconds. The four-seater Clubman is one of the longest models in the British carmaker's lineup.
