headline: Blind man was first to get ride in Google's self-driving car
body: Google recently launched 'Waymo', a company for its self-driving vehicle division. Steve Mahan, a legally blind man from California, was among the first members of public to get a ride in Google’s self-driving car prototype in 2015 without a Google engineer onboard to take over the wheel if needed. Google is working to develop self-driving cars with Fiat Chrysler.

headline: Why do we need self-driving permit but not Tesla, asks Uber
body: Uber has responded to California regulators' order to stop its self-driving taxi service in San Francisco by asking why it is required to get a permit while Tesla's autopilot technology does not need one. The multi-billion dollar startup has argued that its self-driving cars don't need the permit since there is always a human driver behind the wheel.

headline: Google sets up separate self-driving car company 'Waymo'
body: Google on Wednesday announced to set up a separate company focused on its self-driving car push called 'Waymo', which derives its name from Google's mission of finding new way forward in mobility. The independent company will work within the Alphabet umbrella, where Google was also moved last year. Google's self-driving car project was started in 2009.

headline: Faraday Future sued for $10 mn for late payments to supplier
body: Tesla's rival Faraday Future has been sued for $10 million by its supplier named Futuris over late payments. Futuris alleged that Faraday owes it $10 million, of which the payment of $7 million is more than 30 days late. A warehouse owner has also sued Faraday claiming that the company owes it over $100,000 in missed payments.

headline: Nano serious drain on Tata Motors financial resources: Wadia
body: Tata Motors board's independent Director Nusli Wadia in a letter to shareholders said that Nano, a car that was initially priced at ₹1 lakh, has proved to be a serious drain on the company's financial resources. "Even now, when it sells at ₹2.25 lakh, its sale is at a substantial loss to the company," Wadia added.

headline: Porsche wishes Audi on exit from endurance racing in video
body: Porsche has thanked corporate sibling Audi "for all the tough fights" in Le Mans endurance car racing in a video. In October, Audi announced its exit from the World Endurance Championship after an 18-year run, including 13 victories at Le Mans. Audi reportedly withdrew from the championship as parent Volkswagen has been facing increased costs due to Dieselgate emissions scandal.

headline: New JLR system prevents doors from crashing into objects
body: British carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has developed a new technology to prevent the doors of a car from crashing into nearby objects when opened. The system uses existing car sensors to detect approaching cyclists or to measure how far a door can be opened to prevent denting. The system can also help while parking the car in tight spaces.

headline: How do self-driving cars work?
body: Self-driving cars are those which can drive themselves without assistance from a human driver. Such vehicles are equipped with digital cameras, lasers and radar sensors which are embedded around the car, giving it a 360° view of its surroundings. Visual images are converted into code for the car's systems to interpret to control the steering, braking, and throttle.

headline: Why did the shape of cars change from being boxy to curvy?
body: Cars made in the 1970s had boxy designs with sharp edges, while those from the 1990s had curvier, smoother exteriors. This change was caused by a push for fuel efficiency and new technologies that allowed manufacturers to create curved shapes easily. Curved exteriors make the cars less wind resistant, thereby requiring less fuel to travel the same distance.

headline: BMW concept shows floating touch-sensitive display in cars
body: German luxury vehicle manufacturing company BMW has unveiled the concept for a virtual touchscreen that appears to be floating inside the car. The display will show the driver information about music and navigation among other things. BMW has said the floating display will give drivers the sensation of physical touch to avoid distracting them from the road.

headline: Uber ordered to stop self-driving cabs on day of launch
body: Uber has been ordered by regulators to stop testing its self-driving cabs in San Francisco after they were launched on Wednesday. Uber was asked to secure the necessary permit that allows companies to test autonomous vehicles on public roads. However, Uber claims it doesn't need the permit as there is always a standby human driver present in its self-driving cabs.

headline: Uber's self-driving cabs start picking San Francisco riders
body: Uber on Wednesday expanded the pilot of its self-driving taxi service to San Francisco, its second location. The self-driving Volvo XC90 SUVs with a spinning LIDAR sensor and rooftop cameras will be offered to UberX riders. The cars will have a safety driver and Uber test engineer onboard to monitor the rides and take control of the wheel if required.

headline: Uber's self-driving car runs red light on day of launch
body: One of Uber's self-driving taxis was caught running a red light on Wednesday, the same day the service was launched in San Francisco. However, the ride-hailing service has blamed the incident on the human driver who sat behind the wheel of the autonomous car to take control if required. Uber added that it has suspended the driver involved.

headline: Google stops development of own self-driving car: Report
body: Google has reportedly cancelled plans to develop its own self-driving vehicles and will instead pursue partnerships with existing car makers to possibly launch an autonomous ride-sharing service. Google's existing autonomous car fleet consists of Lexus SUVs and two-person pod cars. The company also partnered with Fiat Chrysler earlier this year to produce self-driving minivans.

headline: Uber admits its self-driving cars took dangerous turns
body: Uber has admitted that there's a problem with the way its self-driving cars cross bike lanes in San Francisco, that the advocates fear could have deadly consequences for cyclists. An Uber spokeswoman said engineers are working to fix the flaw in self-driving programming. On the first day of its launch in the city, an Uber car jumped the red light.

headline: Tesla's emergency braking system prevents serious accident
body: The automatic emergency braking of a Tesla Model X electric car recently helped in preventing a potentially serious accident. The car, which was not on Autopilot or semi-autonomous mode, used its sensors and radar to determine an accident was imminent before sounding the alarm and applying the brakes.

headline: Hyundai to hike prices of all models by up to ₹1 lakh
body: Automaker Hyundai India on Tuesday said it will hike prices of all its models by up to ₹1 lakh from January 2017 to offset higher input costs, fluctuating exchange rates and marketing expenses. Citing similar reasons, Nissan Motor India also said that it will increase prices of its vehicles by up to ₹30,000 from next month.

headline: Porsche race car Technical Director joins Apple: Reports
body: Apple reportedly poached the Technical Director of Porsche's race car program Alexander Hitzinger earlier this year. Hitzinger's LinkedIn profile says he left Porsche to join "a technology company" as an engineering executive. Earlier this month, Apple had revealed its plan to make autonomous vehicles in a letter asking regulators to impose fewer restrictions on developers of self-driving cars.

headline: Mercedes launches car-sharing service open to all brands
body: Mercedes-Benz has launched a peer-to-peer car-sharing service called 'Croove' in Munich that lets owners of any car put their vehicle on rent. The Croove app instructs owners on how to price rent, and lets renters find a car that suits their needs. For the duration of the rental, the cars will be insured for up to ₹7 crore.

headline: Faraday Future prototype races Bentley, Ferrari and Tesla
body: Electric car manufacturer Faraday Future has released a video clip in which a prototype of its electric car EV is seen racing Tesla's Model X P100D, Bentley's Bentayga SUV and Ferrari's 488 GTB. The Faraday Future prototype managed to beat each of its opponents in the one-on-one drag races held at California's Irwindale Event Center.

headline: Tata Motors to hike passenger car prices by up to ₹25,000
body: Auto major Tata Motors on Monday said that it will hike prices of its passenger vehicles by up to ₹25,000 in order to offset increased input costs. The company will be increasing prices of its passenger vehicles starting from ₹5,000 up to ₹25,000, depending on the model, Tata Motors said. The increase will be effective from January 1, 2017.

headline: Google's Waymo unveils fleet of self-driving hybrid minivans
body: Waymo, Google's new autonomous vehicle company, has unveiled a fleet of 100 Fiat Chrysler Pacifica minivans. The hybrid cars can go about 48 km in pure electric mode and are fitted with custom computers, sensors and telematics used on Google's Lexus SUV and other self-driving cars. The vehicles will debut on public roads in 2017.

headline: In Pictures: Ferrari Challenge World Finals 2016
body: From December 1 to 4, Ferrari held its annual Finali Mondiali (World Finals) event in Florida's Daytona, the first time in North America, with Ferrari Challenge finalists from around the world competing in the event. There were also demonstrations of past F1 cars, and the last Ferrari LaFerrari ever built was auctioned to help victims of the recent Italy earthquakes.

headline: Hyperloop to reduce Pune-Mumbai travel time to 25 minutes
body: US-based high-speed transportation system Hyperloop, if introduced in India, will reduce the travel time between Pune to Mumbai to only 25 minutes, according to company's Chairman Bibop G Gresta. "You can live in Pune and work in Mumbai or vice-versa," said Gresta. The Hyperloop proposal is with Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari for its feasibility evaluation in the country.

headline: What is Hyperloop transportation and how does it work?
body: American startup Hyperloop Transportation Technologies is developing a high-speed transportation system including vacuum tube trains traveling at speeds up to 1,200 kmph. It claims to cover the distance of 328 kilometres between Washington DC and New York in 30 minutes. The system includes self-driving cars to pick and drop passengers from their location to Hyperloop stations and vice-versa.

headline: Volvo to make world's largest bus to carry 300 passengers
body: Swedish automobile company Volvo has unveiled the world's largest bus chassis called the 'Gran Artic 300', which is 30 metres long and can carry up to 300 passengers. The new bus has been designed for Brazil's BRT system, a transportation system where buses run on dedicated lanes. One biarticulated bus of the model replaces three standard buses.

headline: Startup's electric truck travels 1930 km on one charge
body: US-based electric vehicle startup Nikola has unveiled its new hydrogen fuel cell powered 'Nikola One' semi-truck that claims to travel 1930 kilometres on a single charge. The truck's navigation system will determine the most effective route between destinations. Nikola has also announced plans to build stations to refuel its new trucks, that will be launched in 2020.

headline: Vijay Mallya owns 21 luxury cars, claim hackers
body: Liquor baron Vijay Mallya, whose Twitter account was hacked earlier on Friday, owns at least 21 luxury cars, the hackers claimed in a list tweeted through Mallya's account. The list includes cars from brands including BMW, Ferrari, Jaguar, Mercedes, Porsche, Rolls-Royce and others. Besides the list, various email addresses of Mallya with their passwords were also made public.

headline: BMW remotely locks sleeping thief inside stolen car
body: US police successfully caught a man who had stolen a BMW car by trapping him inside the car with the carmaker's help. After the owner reported the car missing, the police got in touch with BMW to locate the vehicle and remotely lock its doors. The thief was found sleeping inside the stolen vehicle with a small amount of meth.

headline: Fiat heir arrested for faking own kidnapping
body: Lapo Elkann, the grandson of late Fiat patriarch Gianni Agnelli, was arrested in New York last weekend for faking his own kidnapping. The 39-year-old allegedly called his family and told them he was being held against his will in Manhattan and needed $10,000 to be released. Elkann was later found to have spent the weekend consuming drugs with an escort.

headline: One-off Pagani Zonda supercar crashes in Japan
body: A custom-made Pagani Zonda supercar reportedly crashed with a Maybach 62S in Tokyo, Japan earlier this week. The purple Pagani Zonda Zozo was commissioned by Japanese billionaire and Founder of online fashion retail website Zozotown, Yusaku Maezawa. Powered by a 7.3-litre V12 engine, the model delivers 760 horsepower with a reported top speed of 345 kmph.

headline: Donald Trump names General Motors CEO to his advisory panel
body: US President-elect Donald Trump has named General Motors CEO Mary Barra to his economic and job-creation panel. The panel, set to meet for the first time in February, consists of CEOs from JPMorgan Chase, Walt Disney, Boeing, and other companies. Barra is one of the only two women on the panel, the other being IBM CEO Ginni Rometty.

headline: Mercedes unveils headlights that can project images on road
body: Mercedes-Benz has unveiled a headlight system called 'Digital Light' that can project HD images onto the road. The headlights can display navigation directions or the width of the car when trying to squeeze through a gap. The system uses computer chips and mirrors to display the images and can adapt to its environment to adjust the brightness of the beam.

headline: 120 BMW cars damaged after train carrying vehicles derails
body: German vehicle manufacturing company BMW has confirmed that 120 of its cars were damaged on Sunday after a train carrying the vehicles derailed in the US. The train was carrying X model cars from an auto-making plant in South Carolina. Two locomotives and 12 train cars were also damaged, but no human injury was reported.

headline: Ola may deploy 1 million electric cars, says Masayoshi Son
body: Ola investor SoftBank's Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son has said that the ride-hailing startup may introduce a fleet of one million electric cars. The vehicles will be locally manufactured to support the government's 'Make in India' campaign, he added. SoftBank has already invested $2 billion in Indian startups like Ola, Snapdeal, Oyo Rooms, and Grofers among others.

headline: Last LaFerrari ever made to be auctioned for charity
body: Ferrari has announced that it will auction off the last LaFerrari supercar ever made to raise money for earthquake relief in Central Italy. While only 499 hybrid coupes were initially planned, Ferrari will make one more for the auction. Powered by a 6.3-litre V12 engine and an electric motor, the car delivers 950bhp at a top speed of 350 kmph.

headline: Audi technology lets cars communicate with traffic lights
body: Audi has unveiled a system that transmits information from traffic lights to compatible Audi cars over a 4G connection. The system lets drivers see how long it will take red lights on their route to turn green or how fast to go to hit more green lights. Further, engines could be programmed to start immediately as the light turns green.

headline: Mercedes releases new ad seeking Formula One driver
body: Mercedes is running an advertisement seeking a replacement for the newly-retired Formula One world champion Nico Rosberg. "Ideally, you will have a proven track record in skills including steering, braking and in particular, accelerating. Possession of an FIA Super Licence will be an advantage," reads the ad. Rosberg announced his retirement last Friday, after winning his maiden F1 title.

headline: George Hotz makes code behind self-driving project public
body: George Hotz, the hacker known for unlocking the first iPhone, has publicly released the self-driving car software developed by his startup, which he called an "open source alternative to Tesla's Autopilot." Hotz recently cancelled his startup's $999 kit which could be fitted into cars to turn them self-driving as he did not want to "deal with regulators" in the US.

headline: Honda's new electric vehicle to respond to driver's emotions
body: Japanese automaker Honda has claimed that its new electric vehicle concept called 'NeuV' will have an 'emotion engine' that will allow the car to react to its owner's conversations and emotions. The engine integrates artificial intelligence to help the owner make a bond with the vehicle. The concept will be showcased by Honda at consumer technology show CES next year.

headline: Apple letter reveals its self-driving car plans
body: In a letter to US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, technology giant Apple has acknowledged that it is excited about automation in numerous fields, including transportation. Apple added that it wants to test its self-driving car technology and address to both the ethical and regulatory issues. The company has confirmed investing heavily in machine learning and autonomous systems.

headline: Lexus covers car with 42,000 LEDs that respond to music
body: Japanese automaker Toyota's luxury car division Lexus has covered one of its cars in 41,999 programmable LED lights that change colour on owner's gestures and respond to the music being played. The hand-placed LEDs, if placed end-to-end, would stretch at least 800 metres in length. However, the LED-lit car cannot be purchased as it has just been made for display.

headline: Porsche tells how to pronounce its name in new video
body: German sports car company Porsche, which was founded back in 1931, has released a video that tells how to correctly pronounce the company's name. The video tells that Porsche is a two syllable word, that is often mistaken as one. Porsche was named after automotive engineer Ferdinand Porsche, who founded the company and later worked for Adolf Hitler.

headline: Ford, Toyota found guilty of anti-competitive activity
body: The Competition Appellate Tribunal (COMPAT) has upheld Competition Commission's (CCI) order that found automakers Ford, Nissan, and Toyota guilty of anti-competitive practices in the spare parts market. The COMPAT also imposed a 2% penalty on the companies' average annual turnover from spare parts for the three years preceding 2011, the year when the inquiry into the issue had started.

headline: Ferrari to stop selling its retired F1 cars
body: Ferrari has announced the end of its 'Corse Clienti' program that allowed select customers to purchase its retired Formula One cars. It also offered owners a chance to drive the F1 cars at circuits around the world with a full team of mechanics. The cars built for 2014 and onwards will not be sold as they are "difficult to maintain."

headline: Tata Motors suffered from legacy products: Mistry
body: Some “legacy” passenger cars in Tata Motors product portfolio had a "large negative contribution" on the brand perception, ousted Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry has said. Further, the automaker also suffered due to quality and service responsiveness issues, Mistry added. Notably, Mistry had earlier said the loss-making Tata Nano project was not shut down because of emotional reasons.

headline: Last LaFerrari auctioned for ₹47 cr to help quake victims
body: The last new LaFerrari supercar ever made was on Saturday auctioned off for more than ₹47 crore to rebuild the parts of central Italy affected by series of earthquakes. The supercar has become the most valuable 21st-century automobile ever sold at an auction. Notably, a new LaFerrari costs a little over ₹10.2 crore.

headline: Honda Cars sales fall by 20-30% after demonetisation
body: The India arm of Japan's Honda Motor has reported a 20-30% fall in car sales in the retail market since November 9. Honda Cars India senior VP Raman Kumar Sharma said that he doesn't expect retrenchment in the sector as "things are going to improve shortly." Two-wheeler sales are picking up and auto sales will gather steam shortly, he added.\n\n

headline: Volkswagen launches mobility service start-up MOIA
body: German carmaker Volkswagen on Monday unveiled its new mobility brand MOIA under which it plans to focus on ride-hailing, autonomous driving and electric cars in European cities from next year. This comes amid Volkswagen's attempt to become a leading on-demand transport service provider. The business could reportedly generate revenues worth $2.1 billion by decade end.

headline: BMW expands its venture capital fund 5-fold to ₹3,627 crore
body: BMW is increasing the size of its venture capital fund, BMW i Ventures, nearly fivefold to $530 million (₹3,627 crore) from around $106 million (₹725 crore), according to a German business daily. The fund has been focussed on themes such as electric mobility and mobility services, and plans to expand to autonomous driving, digitalisation, cloud services and artificial intelligence.

headline: Big Dog Motorcycles debuts India with a ₹59 lakh bike
body: America's Big Dog Motorcycles has made its debut in India by launching its K9 Red Chopper-111 motorbike priced at ₹59 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi). The 10-foot long bike is powered by an 1807cc 45-degree V-twin engine. No two bikes by the company will be the same in India as it makes only custom bikes.

headline: Apple takeover talks didn't go anywhere, says McLaren CEO
body: McLaren's CEO Mike Flewitt in a recent interview revealed that the company was in talks with technology giant Apple for a takeover, but it never reached a stage where Apple made a bid. He said, "They visited. We talked. We talked about what they did. We talked about what we did. They toured. It never matured to a definitive proposition".

headline: Indian Motorcycle launches new bike in India at ₹31.99 lakh
body: American bike manufacturer Indian Motorcycle has launched its 'Chieftain Dark Horse' bike in India at a starting price of ₹31.99 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi). Powered by a Thunder Stroke 111 1811cc V-twin engine, the motorcycle comes with a solo seat and hard bags on both the sides. It will be available in the country in its signature black matte colour.

headline: New electric car goes 0-100 kmph in 2.7 seconds
body: Chinese startup NextEV has unveiled its first electric car 'NIO EP9' which accelerates from 0-100 kmph in only 2.7 seconds. Powered by four electric motors, the car generates 1,360 hp and has a top speed of 314 kmph. Only six units of the car have been made, which are already bought by the startup's founders at ₹8.1 crore each.

headline: Hero Bicycles unveils electric assist cycle at ₹42,000
body: Bicycle manufacturer Hero Cycles on Thursday unveiled a new brand in India called 'Lectro' which offers a range of electric bikes with pedal assistance, priced between ₹42,000 and ₹83,000. The cycles, with a top speed of 25 kmph, have a detachable battery that can be charged in around 4 hours to travel 50 km.

headline: Australian team unveils pod design at Hyperloop competition
body: VicHyper from Australia, one of the 30 teams selected through Elon Musk-led SpaceX's competition to develop a viable high-speed Hyperloop transport system, has unveiled the design for its pod vehicles. The pod will head to California for testing by SpaceX in January, 2017. The Hyperloop system will reportedly have a top speed of 1,200 kmph.

headline: Rolls-Royce’s engines not up to standard, says Emirates
body: The world’s biggest long-haul airline Emirates said it is unhappy with the performance shortfalls affecting $6.1 billion worth of Rolls-Royce engines it ordered. "We have a new engine coming on and there are some issues with that...We want the engines as promised in the contract," President Tim Clark said. The engines would power a batch of 50 Airbus A380 jets.

headline: Tesla invites people to swap cars with Model S for 1 week
body: Electric carmaker Tesla has launched a 'Drive to Believe' challenge in European markets that will let selected people exchange their cars with Tesla's Model S for one week. According to the company, "It takes driving a Tesla and experiencing its superior performance, safety, and technology to be convinced." Model S claims a range of up to 572 km per charge.

headline: Chinese company made staff jump in front of self-driving car
body: Chinese technology major Baidu made some of its engineers jump in front of an autonomous car in motion, as revealed by Baidu CEO Robin Li in a speech. The company undertook the stunt to demonstrate the ability of its driverless cars to prevent collisions. Although the car stopped in time, Li said he "felt it was a little risky."

headline: Uber-owned startup ran driverless truck without license
body: Self-driving technology startup Otto, which demonstrated a driverless truck in Nevada and got acquired by Uber, did not have a license for autonomous testing and knowingly broke the traffic rules, according to an investigative study. However, Otto didn't face any consequences as the current rules don't punish violations. Amendments to the current regulations could introduce penalties only by 2017.

headline: Man crashes car during auto show, injures eight people
body: A 24-year-old man crashed a Fiat 500 electric vehicle into a concrete pot, which broke and injured eight people during a test drive at the Los Angeles Auto Show on Tuesday. While no one sustained life-threatening injuries, six people were hospitalised, including the driver. The driver reportedly did not have a valid driving license.

headline: Trump is a game changer for auto industry, says Fiat CEO
body: Italian automaker Fiat's CEO Sergio Marchionne has said, Donald Trump's election as the US President is "a game changer" for the auto industry. "I think that there are a number of conditions in US which are not yet spelled out," added Marchionne. Trump called for 35% tariff on products made by companies which are moving production out of the US.

headline: 7 Maruti models in 10 best selling passenger vehicles in Oct
body: Seven of Maruti Suzuki India's passenger vehicle models have featured among the top 10 selling brands in October. Further, Maruti’s Alto retained the first position with 18,854 units during the period under review, according to the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers' data. Further, Renault’s entry-level model Kwid and Honda Car's mid-sized sedan City also featured among the top 10.

headline: Singapore tests self-driving scooters for pedestrians
body: Singapore-based researchers are testing self-driving scooters to curb accidents involving pedestrians who are on their phones. The one-seater weighs 50 kg and travels at a top speed of 6 kmph. The scooters move along a predefined route on footpaths and make use of laser sensors to navigate around obstacles and avoid collisions.

headline: BMW cancels self-driving car project with China's Baidu
body: BMW and Chinese technology major Baidu have called off their partnership to develop self-driving cars. "We have now found that the development pace and ideas of the two companies are a little different," said BMW's China CEO Olaf Kastner. Baidu had been using BMW 3 sedans for on-road tests in China, but will use Ford's Lincoln for its US testing.

headline: In pictures: Cars at the Los Angeles Auto Show 2016
body: A number of cars including electric vehicles were showcased at the annual Los Angeles Auto Show, which took place from November 18-27. While Bentley, Bugatti, Ferrari, McLaren, and Rolls-Royce skipped the show, Jaguar, Alfa Romeo, Lamborghini, and Mercedes participated in the show. A Chinese startup unveiled electric car 'Nio EP9', which accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 2.7 seconds.

headline: Intel forms a dedicated self-driving car technology unit
body: World's largest chip maker Intel has formed a new unit called 'Autonomous Driving Group' dedicated to self-driving car technology. Intel recently announced that it’s making $250 million bet on self-driving technology via its Intel Capital investment arm. Autonomous driving will only be a part of the new vertical as Intel will also focus on driver assist technologies.

headline: Tesla's 'instant' acceleration avoids rear-end accident
body: A video captured by a Tesla Model S P85D's rear-mounted dashcam shows how the car's 'instant torque' feature helped avoid a rear-end collision. The video shows a speeding Toyota Prius coming from behind the stopped Tesla car. Through the ability of Tesla's electric motors to speed up instantly, the driver was able to accelerate before the Prius collided into it.

headline: Maserati to launch its first electric car in 2020
body: Italian luxury vehicle manufacturer Maserati has announced to launch its first all-electric car in 2020. It will be an electric version of its two-seater sports car Alfieri, which is scheduled to launch in 2019. Maserati's electric car would not rival Elon Musk-led Tesla's Model S, but instead will be a grand-touring coupe.

headline: Volkswagen set to cut 30,000 jobs after emissions scandal
body: German automaker Volkswagen has reached an agreement with workers to cut up to 30,000 jobs globally and save $3.9 billion in expenses as it deals with its emissions-cheating scandal, reports said. “This is a big step forward, maybe the biggest in the company’s history,” brand chief Herbert Diess said. Earlier, Volkswagen admitted that it rigged fuel emission tests since 2009.

headline: Video shows how a Tesla car drives itself
body: Elon Musk-led electric car making startup Tesla has released a video which shows how it looks like from the inside of a car when it fully drives itself. While the car's steering can be seen moving on its own, three different camera views show the car detecting lanes, people, traffic lights, other cars, signs and houses on the road.

headline: Volkswagen to cut spending over next four years
body: Volkswagen has said it will reduce capital expenditure to 6% of automotive sales by 2020 from 6.9% last year. This comes as the German automaker looks to fund its strategic shift to electric cars apart from reeling with the cost of the emissions scandal. Volkswagen has also announced 30,000 job cuts which could save the carmaker around $3.9 billion.

headline: Largest collection of model cars has over 37,000 pieces
body: Nabil "Billy" Karam from Lebanon, who has 37,777 toy cars, recently established the Guinness World Record for the 'largest collection of model cars'. The former racing driver broke his own record set in 2011, by adding 10,000 model cars since then. He also has the record for the 'largest collection of dioramas', meaning miniature exhibits, which includes 577 items.

headline: BlackBerry starts testing self-driving cars in Canada
body: Canada has started testing its first self-driving cars developed by technology company BlackBerry. The pilot program also includes cars made by automaker Erwin Hymer Group and the University of Waterloo. The project will test the vehicles at various stages of automation in varying weather conditions and road qualities found in Canada's most populated province, Ontario.

headline: Electric carmaker raises ₹9 crore through crowdfunding
body: Sweden-based startup Uniti has raised nearly ₹9 crore ($1.3 million) through a crowdfunding campaign for its three-wheeled electric vehicle. The two-seater cars, which will cost about ₹14.8 lakh each, claim a top speed of 130 kmph and a range of 150 km on a single charge. The car aims to rival Renault and Nissan's electric vehicles.

headline: 4-year-old boy test drives McLaren's electric car
body: British sports carmaker McLaren has shared a video of a four-year-old boy test driving its fully electric 'McLaren P1' car for kids. The open-top car can accelerate from 0 kmph to a top speed of 4.8 kmph in two seconds. Priced at nearly ₹32,000, the car comes with an MP3 player pre-loaded with popular nursery rhymes.

headline: Video shows the evolution of the F1 steering wheel
body: A three-minute video describes the evolution of Formula One car steering wheels from the 1950s to the present day. It highlights the transition from traditional wood and aluminium wheels to the modern angular, carbon-fibre 'controller' with hand-clutch and gear-shifting, programmable switches and LCD display. Wheels used by F1 legends Ayrton Senna and Michael Schumacher have also been featured.

headline: Mercedes S 500 convertible launched in India at ₹2.25 crore
body: German automaker Mercedes-Benz has launched the S 500 Cabriolet in India at a price of ₹2.25 crore (ex-showroom, New Delhi). The luxury car, equipped with a 4.7-litre, V8 bi-turbo petrol engine, can go from 0-100 kmph in 4.6 seconds and has a top speed of 250 kmph. The company also presented its C-300 Cabriolet, which is priced at ₹60 lakh.

headline: India's cheapest Porsche launched at ₹76.84 lakh
body: German car maker Porsche on Tuesday launched the 'Macan R4' SUV in India at ₹76.84 lakh (ex-showroom, Maharashtra), making it the cheapest Porsche vehicle available in the country. Powered by a 2.0-litre petrol engine, the car generates 252 horsepower, accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 6.7 seconds and has a top speed of 229 kmph.

headline: Vespa launches scooter priced at ₹12 lakh in India
body: Italian two-wheeler brand Piaggio on Tuesday launched the 'Vespa 946 Emporio Armani Edition' in India at ₹12,04,970 (ex-showroom, Pune) to mark the 40th anniversary of fashion brand Giorgio Armani. The Vespa 946 Emporio Armani, which is the second most expensive scooter in India, is powered by a 125cc single-cylinder engine that generates 11.7 bhp of power.

headline: Centre proposes making airbags mandatory in all vehicles
body: The Centre has proposed making it mandatory for manufacturers to provide airbags, rear-view sensors and speed warning systems in all new vehicles from October 2017. The Road Transport and Highways Ministry in a draft notification also proposed the setting up of its own safety authority, the Bharat National Car Assessment Programme (NCAP), which will rate vehicles on safety.

headline: Man drives Mini Cooper on side wheels for 20 km
body: A world record-holding Chinese driver named Yue Han, recently completed the Nordschleife lap in Germany's Nürburgring racing complex entirely on the left two wheels of a Mini Cooper. The feat involved negotiating 73 corners and a 300-metre difference in elevation over a 20.8-km track. Han finished the task in a record 46 minutes, averaging a speed of around 27 kmph.

headline: Jaguar unveils its first ever electric car
body: Jaguar Land Rover's luxury arm Jaguar on Monday unveiled the 'I-PACE' SUV, the company's first ever all-electric vehicle. Powered by a 90 kilowatt-hour lithium-ion battery pack, it generates 400 horsepower and accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 4 seconds. Aimed to travel about 354 kilometres on one charge, the car is scheduled to launch in 2018.

headline: Indian Motorcycle launches new tourer bike at ₹31 lakh
body: The owner of Indian Motorcycle brand, Polaris India on Thursday launched the Indian Springfield tourer bike in India at ₹31.07 lakh (ex-showroom, Gurugram). Powered by a Thunder Stroke 1811cc engine, it generates 138.9 Nm torque at 2,600 rpm. The bike can be converted from a tourer into a cruiser by removing the quick-release windshield and saddlebags.

headline: Volkswagen admits Audi also had emissions cheating software
body: German carmaker Volkswagen has admitted that automatic Audi cars have technology that can distort or cheat emissions when they are tested. Volkswagen-owned carmakers Audi and Porsche vehicles have been proved to emit up to nine times legally allowable pollution levels. In one of the biggest automobile scandals, Volkswagen had admitted fitting emissions cheating devices in 11 million of its cars.

headline: Startup unveils 3D printed bike 50% lighter than other bikes
body: US-based startup Divergent 3D has unveiled a 3D printed bike at the ongoing Los Angeles Auto Show, which it claims to be 50% lighter than traditional bikes. While the bike's chassis is 3D printed, its motor has been borrowed from a Kawasaki H2 supercharged sportbike. Last year, the startup unveiled a 3D printed supercar called 'Blade'.

headline: Samsung buys Harman for $8 bn to enter smart car market
body: South Korean electronics maker Samsung on Monday bought Harman, a US-based auto and audio product making company, for $8 billion in an all-cash deal. The move will help Samsung in its plan to enter the smart car market. Samsung said this is the largest ever overseas deal by a single South Korean company.

headline: Audi builds Final Fantasy-themed car for ₹3.16 crore
body: Audi has built a ₹3.16-crore limited edition R8 sports car based on Final Fantasy, a science fiction video game. Powered by a 5.2-litre V10 engine, it delivers 610 horsepower, accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 3.2 seconds, and has a top speed of 330 kmph. Only one unit of the car has been made, which will be sold through lottery.

headline: Pawan Goenka elevated to Managing Director of Mahindra
body: India's largest utility vehicle manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra on Friday said Executive Director Pawan Goenka has been elevated to the position of Managing Director, and Anand Mahindra was redesignated as the Executive Chairman. This is in line with the practice followed by Mahindra Group companies, where the position of Managing Director is kept distinct from the Chairman, the automaker said.

headline: Toyota agrees to ₹22k cr settlement in US class action suit
body: Toyota Motor has agreed to a settlement of up to $3.4 billion (over ₹22,000 crore) for a class action suit filed by the US owners of pickup trucks and SUVs. The settlement covers about 1.5 million vehicles which have allegedly received inadequate rust protection. This could lead to corrosion serious enough to jeopardize the car's structural integrity, court papers stated.

headline: Lexus unveils spaceship designed for upcoming movie
body: Lexus, the luxury vehicle division of Japanese automaker Toyota, has unveiled its design for a spaceship called 'Skyjet' for the upcoming science fiction movie 'Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets' starring Cara Delevingne. The Skyjet is a 28th-century single-seat pursuit   craft and features Lexus' "spindle" grille with the headlight design of the 2018 Lexus LC coupe.

headline: Volkswagen claims 'defeat device' is legal in EU
body: German automaker Volkswagen has claimed that the software allowing its diesel vehicles to evade emission rules does not violate European law. "The software represents no unlawful defeat device under EU law...there's no question of manipulation," said Volkswagen. The company had agreed to a $16.5 billion settlement in the US last year for fitting the 'defeat device' in 11 million vehicles.

headline: In photos: Mini unveils its first ever plug-in hybrid model
body: British automaker Mini on Wednesday unveiled 'Countryman S E', its first petrol-electric plug-in hybrid model. The 3-cylinder petrol engine and electric motor together produce a total output of 224 hp. Based on parent company BMW's all electric eDrive technology, the electric mode alone will have a top speed of 125 kmph with a range of 40 kilometres on a charge.

headline: Porsche opens ₹406-cr experience center with racetrack in LA
body: German automobile manufacturer Porsche has opened a ₹406-crore experience center in Los Angeles, which has a racetrack where the company's customers can drive their cars. The racetrack has two circuits with a total of eight different training modules, a racecar exhibition, and a high-end restaurant. Besides Porsche's existing owners, visitors are also allowed for a 90-minute driving session.

headline: 50% of all new Jaguar Land Rover cars to be electric by 2020
body: Jaguar Land Rover CEO Ralf Speth has said that half of the company's new vehicles will be offered with the hybrid or electric option by 2020. "We are developing our own approach to autonomy, connectivity and electrification," he said. The Tata Motors-owned automaker recently unveiled its first all-electric Jaguar I-PACE SUV concept at the Los Angeles Auto Show.

headline: Audi R8 Exclusive Edition gets laser beam headlights
body: German automobile manufacturer Audi is launching an Exclusive Edition of its R8 coupe in the US, which comes with laser beam headlights. A converter adjusts the 450-nanometer laser into visible light that fires up above 64 kmph. The edition will be available to only 25 consumers in the US.

headline: In Pictures: Mercedes-Maybach S 650 convertible
body: German automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz has revealed its limited edition Mercedes-Maybach S 650 convertible. Powered by a 6.0-litre engine, the car produces 621 horsepower with a reported top speed of about 250 kmph. The company will sell only 300 units of the car, along with a travel luggage set matching its interiors, at $323,000 (approx ₹2.2 crore).

headline: World's smallest roadworthy car is 63.5 centimetres tall
body: The world's smallest roadworthy car has a height of 63.5 centimetres, a width of  65.41 centimetres and is 126.47 centimetres long, as per Guinness World Records. The car is licenced to be driven on public roads with a speed limit of 40 km/h. Created by Austin Coulson from the US, it was measured in Texas on September 7, 2012.

headline: Volkswagen to fix, buyback 80,000 cars over emissions scam
body: Volkswagen has reached an agreement with US regulators for a mix of buybacks and fixes for around 80,000 polluting Audi, Porsche, and Volkswagen 3.0-litre vehicles, reports stated. The German automaker had reached a separate $10.03-billion buyback offer for 4.75 lakh 2.0-litre vehicles in June. Notably, the carmaker has already agreed to spend up to $16.5 billion over the emissions scandal.

headline: Volkswagen being probed for destroying documents
body: The US Federal Trade Commission has said that it has been investigating whether Volkswagen destroyed documents related to the emissions cheating scandal. The German automaker had admitted in September 2015 that it installed a secret software in its diesel cars to cheat exhaust emissions tests. Volkswagen has agreed to spend up to $16.5 billion to date, over the scandal.

headline: Mahindra's net profit up 21.78% in September quarter
body: Country’s biggest utility vehicle maker Mahindra and Mahindra has reported a 21.78% year-on-year increase in its standalone net profit, which stood at ₹1,163.27 crore for the September quarter. Mahindra's revenue also surged 14.98% from the year-ago period to ₹11,166.22 crore, owing to new launches and better monsoon. The domestic sales of its utility vehicles also rose 15.6% during the quarter.

headline: Honda to produce 80 business jets annually by March 2019
body: Japan-based carmaker Honda expects to produce 80 business jets annually by March 2019 from up to 36 currently, Honda Aircraft Company CEO Michimasa Fujino has said. The company began deliveries of its $4.5 million jets in December and says it has received around 100 orders so far. Notably, Honda is Japan's first automaker to develop aircraft globally.

headline: Auto industry can contribute over 12% to India's GDP: Maruti
body: Indian automobile industry can contribute over 12% to the country’s GDP and generate around 6.5 crore additional jobs over the next decade, a top Maruti Suzuki India official said on Wednesday. Currently, the automobile industry is contributing 7.1% to the GDP of India and around 3.2 crore people are employed directly and indirectly by the sector, he added.

headline: Nissan launches Terrano AMT starting at ₹13.75 lakh
body: Auto major Nissan has launched an all-new 6-Speed Advanced Auto Drive variant of Terrano SUV at a starting price of ₹13.75 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). It features a 1.5-litre diesel engine, generating 110 PS of power and 248 NM of torque leading to an efficient fuel efficiency of 19.61 Kmpl. The result is smooth, computer-controlled gearshifts for a stress-free drive.

headline: Off-road car concept without wheels unveiled
body: South Korean carmaker Hyundai's subsidiary Kia Motors recently unveiled an off-road SUV named 'Sorento Ski Gondola', which has triangular tanks tracks instead of wheels. It combines all-terrain capabilities and autonomous technology, allowing users to control the vehicle via a tablet located inside the cabin. The SUV's interior is waterproof to protect against ice and snow.

headline: Akhilesh Yadav's ₹5 crore campaign bus has in-built elevator
body: Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav is campaigning in a customized Mercedes-Benz bus for the upcoming assembly elections, that cost him ₹5 crore and features an in-built elevator. The elevator gives Yadav access to the roof of the bus, enabling him to address the locals gathered around. The bus also has bulletproof glass, a kitchen, a living area and an office.

headline: Self-driving electric truck that builds in 4 hrs unveiled
body: UK-based startup Charge has unveiled a self-driving electric truck that takes only four hours to be built by a single person. Made with ultra-lightweight materials, the truck produces zero emissions for the first 160 kilometers it travels. The truck will be available for sale by the next year.

headline: Self-driving cars won’t work in India: Maruti Chairman
body: Maruti Suzuki Chairman RC Bhargava in an interview said that self-driving cars won't work in India as “nobody obeys any of the driving rules”. He added, "How will you devise a technology that will predict customer behaviour? Nobody can predict customer behaviour". Bhargava. however, said that he'd love to see people put self-driving technology to use in Indian driving conditions.

headline: BMW posts record profit at $2 billion in Sep quarter
body: German luxury carmaker BMW on Friday posted record net profit at $2 billion, a rise of 15.3% against the year-ago period for the September quarter. The company attributed the rise to selling record number of vehicles. Notably, the group sold more than 5,83,000 cars in the period, posting a 7.1% increase from the year-ago period.

headline: Nano failed to meet customer aspirations: Maruti Chairman
body: Maruti Suzuki India Chairman RC Bhargava on Thursday said Tata Nano failed because it did not meet the aspirations of customers "in totality". "The project at that price became an insurmountable challenge," he stated. When two-wheeler owners look to upgrade their vehicles, they look for the luxury a car can offer and not just another means of transportation, he added.

headline: Three Apple employees quit to join Tesla, Ford
body: Three members of Apple's communications team have quit to join car companies Tesla and Ford in the past few weeks. This comes after it was rumoured that Apple has decided to scale back its plans to make an autonomous car under its Project Titan. The team working on Apple's self-driving vehicles has been given a deadline of late 2017.

headline: Israeli firm creates '100% more fuel efficient' car engine
body: An Israeli firm named Aquarius Engines claims to have created an internal combustion engine with more than twice the efficiency of currently available alternatives. The $100 engine, which the firm says can allow cars to run up to 1,600 km on a full tank, replaces the traditional multiple-vertical piston engine with a novel single-horizontal piston design.

headline: Tesla adds an all-glass roof to the Model S
body: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle-making startup Tesla has added an all-glass roof option to Model S for an additional $1,500 (nearly ₹1 lakh) over the base model priced at $76,200 (approximately ₹50.9 lakh). Tesla claims that the glass roof blocks 98% of UV rays and 81% of the heat. Tesla Model 3, launching next year, will feature a similar glass roof.

headline: In Pictures: Cars owned by Bollywood actor Ranbir Kapoor
body: Bollywood actor Ranbir Kapoor is known to have purchased four luxury cars, the most recent of which is a 4.4-litre diesel engine Range Rover. He also owns a white Audi A8 L with crimson interiors and a Mercedes-AMG G63 which can travel at 210 kmph. He also owned an Audi R8 sports car which he has now reportedly sold.

headline: Man customised Harley-Davidson bike to look like a burger
body: Harry Sperl or 'Hamburger Harry' in USA owns a 1987 Harley-Davidson Sportster bike which is customised to look like a hamburger. The top bun of the 'Hamburger Harley' is fitted with hydraulic cylinders, the beef patty is tuned to emit steam like a warm real-life meat patty, and the stereo plays the sound of frying burgers.

headline: New Ford software will automatically change car direction
body: Ford has announced the development of features like 'evasive steering' that will change the direction of the car if it predicts an accident through its radar system. The cars will be able to park themselves without the driver's input and give audio and visual warnings if they sense wrong-way driving. Additionally, the headlight beam will automatically be widened at roundabouts.

headline: BlackBerry partners with Ford to make 'cars of the future'
body: Canadian technology company BlackBerry has partnered with American automaker Ford to make 'cars of the future' by providing software to help develop self-driving cars. BlackBerry has previously worked with startups to develop technology that brakes a car automatically when it spots something in its path. Ford has announced plans of selling 1,00,000 self-driven taxis by 2021.

headline: Hyundai to let users make calls by pointing at windscreen
body: Automaker Hyundai has partnered with Seoul-based startup VTouch to commercially produce gesture-based heads-up displays (HUDs) by the end of 2017. The display above the dashboard will let drivers browse through music, make calls or set navigation just by making gestures with their fingers towards the windscreen. BMW recently unveiled a similar concept called 'AirTouch' for its 7 Series.

headline: Toyota makes device that turns smartphone into car key
body: Toyota has made a Bluetooth-enabled device called 'Smart Key Box' that allows users to unlock and start a car's engine by just using their smartphone. The device is aimed at people who want to share their vehicle to make money. A code on smartphone is sent via an app, which allows user to access the device acting like car's key.

headline: Ford delays sales report due to fire at headquarters
body: American automotive company Ford on Monday delayed the release of its monthly sales report because of an electrical fire at its global headquarters. The fire interrupted power to the company's main data centers where sales are reported and tracked. However, Ford said the data was protected during the power outage by the system's battery backups.

headline: Volvo launches S90 sedan in India at ₹53.5 lakh
body: Swedish car manufacturer Volvo on Friday launched its flagship sedan S90 in India at a starting price of ₹53.5 lakh (ex-showroom, Mumbai). Powered by a 2-litre diesel engine, it generates 190PS of power and has a top speed of 230 kmph. The car will compete against the likes of Audi A6, BMW 5 Series, Mercedes-Benz E Class and Jaguar XF.

headline: Tata Motors posts strongest car sales in 4 years
body: Tata Motors on Tuesday said that it has posted the highest car sales in four years with a growth of 28% in October as against the year-ago period amid strong festive demand. Further, total sales grew 21% during the period under review. The hatchback Tiago continues to be the volume driver, with retail showing a firm pick-up, the company said.

headline: Hyundai posts highest ever monthly sales in October
body: Automotive major Hyundai Motor India on Tuesday reported its highest ever monthly sales at 64,372 units in October, a 4.3% rise against the year-ago period. This came after Hyundai saw its highest-ever domestic volume during the month, the company said. This also came amid the recently launched Elantra receiving an overwhelming response, CEO YK Koo said.

headline: Suzuki to invest ₹6.4k cr in 2nd production line in Gujarat
body: Japan's Suzuki Motor will invest about 100 billion yen (₹6,400 crore) in a yet-to-be-functional second production line at its new Gujarat plant, reports said. The second line could debut in 2019 and will have the same capacity as the first production line, which is slated to start in 2017. This could raise the automaker's capacity to 2 million cars annually.

headline: Tesla rival Fisker's first car travels 640 km on one charge
body: Elon-Musk founded electric car startup Tesla's rival Fisker on Monday revealed its first electric luxury sedan named 'EMotion', which claims to travel over 640 kilometres on a single charge. The car will have all the hardware required to allow full self-driving ability in the future, and a top speed of 259 kmph.

headline: Video shows Tesla battery exploding after crash
body: A one-minute video shows the lithium-ion battery of a Tesla Model S exploding like fireworks after the car crashed into a tree. The collision, which took place on Thursday in the US, killed the driver and passenger. "Some of the smaller cells that had broken apart began firing off almost like projectiles," said a fire department representative.

headline: Volvo self-driving cars to be unmarked to avoid 'bullies'
body: Volvo's first self-driving cars in Britain will be unmarked so that aggressive drivers do not attempt to "bully" them. "People will challenge...with really harsh braking in front of a self-driving car or putting themselves in the way", said a Volvo executive. According to a study by the London School of Economics, autonomous cars are seen as "easier to deal with".

headline: Maruti's domestic sales rose 2.2% in October
body: Country's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki India's domestic sales rose 2.2% to 1.23 lakh units over a year-ago period, the company said in a statement on Tuesday. The muted growth came due to a 9.8% decline in the sales of its entry-level models of Wagon R and Alto. Maruti's sales of compact car models also dropped 1.8% to 50,116 units.

headline: Volkswagen board calls meet over brand overhaul: Report
body: Volkswagen's supervisory board is set to hold an 'extraordinary meeting' on November 4 over the restructuring of the carmaker's brand, reports claimed. This comes amid the management and labour leaders seeking to agree on matters like cutting costs and investments. The supervisory board is also scheduled to meet on November 18 to ratify the group's spending plans through 2021.

headline: 1st delivery by Uber's self-driving truck is 50k beer cans
body: Uber's 18-wheeler self-driving truck recently made its first ever delivery by transporting 50,000 cans of Budweiser beer across nearly 200 km in the US. The delivery was in partnership with brewing company AB InBev and each can read, "First delivery by self-driving truck". The Volvo truck was supplied by Otto, a self-driving vehicle group acquired by Uber in August.

headline: New MINI Cooper launched in India on Amazon at ₹39.90 lakh
body: The MINI Cooper S Carbon Edition has been launched in India exclusively on e-commerce platform Amazon at ₹39.90 lakh. Only 20 units of the hatchback are available for sale in the country. Powered by a 2.0-litre turbo petrol engine, it generates 192 hp and accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 6.7 seconds.

headline: 19-yr-old Indian builds car by watching YouTube videos
body: A 19-year-old teenager from Mumbai, Prem Thakur has made a working two-seater car at a cost of ₹2.50 lakh by watching YouTube videos. While Thakur welded the chassis and did the paintjob, the engine and transmission were sourced from a second hand Hyundai Accent. The car sports LED headlamps, turn indicators, and a music system with a USB port.

headline: Tesla posts second quarterly profit in 13-year history
body: American electric car manufacturer Tesla on Wednesday announced its first profit after 12 consecutive quarterly losses, and only the second profitable quarter in its 13-year history. The company, led by Elon Musk, recorded net income of $21.9 million for the third quarter compared to a loss of $229.9 million a year earlier. Tesla's revenue more than doubled to $2.3 billion.

headline: George Hotz cancels kit made to turn cars self-driving
body: George Hotz, the hacker known for unlocking the first iPhone, has cancelled the kit developed by his startup Comma.ai, which could be fitted into cars to turn them self-driving. A US regulatory agency had asked Comma.ai for information regarding safety following which Hotz tweeted, "Would much rather spend my life building amazing tech than dealing with regulators...It isn't worth it."

headline: Mumbai Fire Brigade gets customised Royal Enfield bikes
body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade recently showcased customised Royal Enfield Himalayan motorcycles which will be used by the force in the city. The bikes will be fitted with high-pressure water pumps with a capacity of 60 litres. The modded bikes will reportedly cost ₹9-10 lakhs, while the stock bike costs around ₹1.55 lakhs (ex-showroom, Mumbai).

headline: Hyundai Motor's profit hits record low of $935 million
body: South Korean automaker Hyundai Motor's net profit fell 10% to hit a record low of $935 million for the third quarter ended September. This marks a fall in the company's profit for 11th consecutive quarter. In July to September this year, the company's domestic factories were hit by its worst labour strike.

headline: Honda Civic removed from list of most reliable cars
body: Consumer-advocacy organisation Consumer Reports on Monday released its list of 2016's most reliable car models based on road-test scores, owner satisfaction data and independent safety testing. Honda Civic, Mini Cooper and Volkswagen Jetta are among the cars no longer recommended to buyers. Japanese automaker Honda's rank fell to 10 from 8 last year on the list of reliable car brands.

headline: BMW, Ola tie up for luxury cab services
body: Luxury carmaker BMW and taxi-hailing app Ola have entered into an agreement to provide on-demand luxury cab services in India. The tie-up will allow Ola cab operators to avail cheaper credit to buy BMW cars, receive after-sales support and guaranteed buyback. Ola will induct BMW cars across Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru as a part of its Ola ‘Lux’ fleet.

headline: Hero MotoCorp to invest ₹205 cr in electric vehicle startup
body: Indian motorcycle manufacturer Hero MotoCorp has announced to invest ₹205 crore in Bengaluru-based electric vehicle startup Ather Energy. The company will pick up a 26-30% stake in the startup which claims to make India's first smart electric scooter, S340. Founded in 2013, Ather Energy has previously raised funding from Tiger Global Management, and Flipkart Co-founder Sachin and Binny Bansal.

headline: Tesla rival Atieva rebrands itself as Lucid Motors
body: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's rival Atieva has changed its name to Lucid Motors. The Silicon Valley-based startup will unveil a concept of its electric sedan by the end of this year and begin the sales by 2018. It will be powered by an 87 kWh battery that generates 900 horsepower and provides acceleration from 0-100 kmph in under 3 seconds.

headline: 6 Maruti Suzuki models in top ten list in Apr-Sep
body: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki saw six of its models featuring in the top ten selling list in the first half of 2016-17, helping the company maintain its 47.2% market share in the domestic passenger vehicles market, data revealed. Further, the firm's car Alto retained its position as the best selling model in April-September period, despite a 7.93% decline year-on-year.

headline: Tuned Lamborghini Huracán Spyder goes 0-100 kmph in 2.7 sec
body: German car-tuning company DMC has unveiled a customised Lamborghini Huracán Spyder that can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in under 2.7 seconds, down from the original 3.4 seconds. The power output has also been boosted to 1073 hp with a pair of turbochargers. The car has a top speed of 345 kmph, while the stock version can travel at 324 kmph.

headline: Toyota's Lexus listed as the most reliable carmaker
body: Japanese automotive manufacturer Toyota Motor Corp's Lexus and Toyota brands have been listed as the two most reliable car brands in an annual reliability ranking by consumer advocacy group Consumer Reports. Toyota Prius was rated the most reliable car of 2016 followed by Lexus CT 200h based on road test scores, owner satisfaction data and independent safety testing.

headline: Consumer Reports ranks Tesla among least reliable carmakers
body: Consumer-advocacy organisation Consumer Reports on Monday ranked autonomous carmaker Tesla 25 on a list of 29 automakers, calling it one of the least reliable car brands. Consumer Reports has also listed Tesla's Model X as the sixth least reliable car of 2016, calling it "more showy than practical". The car's "falcon wing" doors are said to be a problem area.

headline: 'Volkswagen's shift to electric cars may cost over 10k jobs'
body: Volkswagen expects the shift to electric cars to cost over 10,000 jobs in coming years, the carmaker's Human Resources Chief Karlheinz Blessing was reported to have said. Volkswagen's works council is reportedly in talks with the company's brand management over a turnaround plan and expects up to 25,000 staff to be cut over the next decade as older workers retire.

headline: Nissan converts electric van into mobile office
body: Japanese automobile manufacturer Nissan in collaboration with design firm Studio Hardie transformed its e-NV200 electric van into a mobile office. The e-NV200 Workspace includes a desk space, touchscreen PC and pop-up coffee machine along with Wi-Fi and app-controlled lighting. The emission-free mobile workplace can travel for up to 170 kilometres on a single charge.

headline: Singapore to turn regular buses self-driving with sensors
body: Singapore has launched a new pilot program where large buses will be turned into self-driving buses with high-tech sensors. Once ready, the buses will travel roughly 1.4 kilometre between a university and a nearby industrial park for field trials. A month ago, self-driving car technology startup nuTonomy started testing its cars in Singapore.

headline: Faraday Future shows its first production car in new clip
body: Elon Musk's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has released a short 15-second video clip showing its first production car riding in a desert. No sound of the engine is audible in the clip, where the company says, "Can't hear the engine? You're not supposed to". This is the first time that the company has shown its working prototype.

headline: Volkswagen's $14.7 bn settlement over emission scam approved
body: A US judge on Tuesday approved Volkswagen's $14.7 billion (over ₹98,000 crore) settlement with the federal and California regulators, and vehicle owners over its diesel emissions cheating scandal. The German automaker said it would begin buying back polluting cars in mid-November. Owners will get the pre-scandal "trade-in" value of the vehicle and $5,100 to $10,000 in additional compensation.

headline: In Pictures: 2017 Michelin Design Challenge winners
body: French tyre manufacturer Michelin has announced the winners of the global 2017 Michelin Design Challenge "Le Mans 2030: Design for the Win". Works by individuals and teams from Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, Czech Republic, India, Portugal, and Russia were among the winners and finalists that were selected from more than 1,600 registrants representing 80 countries.

headline: Hyundai Motor executives to take 10% voluntary pay cut
body: In the first such move in seven years, South Korean automaker Hyundai Motor has said that about 1,000 of its executives will take a 10% voluntary pay cut. Applicable from this month, the pay cuts will affect executives at 51 group companies. It comes amid concerns of Hyundai's falling market share in China, South Korea, and other emerging markets.

headline: General Motors net profit jumps 103.6%
body: Vehicle manufacturer General Motors on Tuesday posted a 103.6% increase in net profit to $2.77 billion for the quarter ended September, as against the year-ago period. Further, the company's revenue increased by 10% to $42.83 billion, a quarterly record for the company. The growth came amid strong truck sales in its home US market and continued strength in China.

headline: Mahindra launches new platform for used cars auction
body: Mahindra's used car sales platform Mahindra First Choice Wheels on Monday launched a new platform named 'True Time Bids' that allows buyers to participate in traditional 'on-the-ground' used car auctions via the internet in real-time. Vehicle auctions are typically conducted offline while some are also done online to attract non-local bidders. Mahindra's platform combines both the auction formats.

headline: Audi tests car-sharing services with red A4 sedan fleet
body: German automobile manufacturer Audi has announced its foray into the car-sharing business with a pilot 'Shared Fleet' program. Customers will be able to locate and unlock their assigned red Audi A4 sedans with a connected smartphone app. The pricing for Audi's fleet is said to be based off the time used, not the distance driven.

headline: BMW recalls 1.5 lakh vehicles in US, Canada
body: German carmaker BMW is recalling 1.5 lakh vehicles registered in the United States and Canada for a fuel pump problem that could cause stalling, the company has said. However, BMW told the US regulators that no injuries have been reported due to to the said fault. Of the vehicles recalled, nearly 88% are registered in the United States, reports said.

headline: Bajaj Auto profit rises 6.68% to ₹1,122 cr in Q2
body: Two-wheeler manufacturer Bajaj Auto has reported a 6.68% year-on-year growth in the second quarter profit, which stood at ₹1,122 crore. Bajaj’s income from operations was up marginally by 0.38% from the corresponding period a year ago to ₹6,432 crore. However, Bajaj Auto sold 10.3 lakh units in the quarter, compared to 10.56 lakh units sold in the year-ago period.

headline: LeEco unveils self-driving car with foldable steering wheel
body: Chinese technology company LeEco on Wednesday unveiled its autonomous electric car 'LeSee Pro' in San Francisco. The steering wheel of the car folds up and retreats into the dashboard when the car is in autonomous mode. It also features an exterior light display that shifts between five different colours to let pedestrians know which the mode the car is in.

headline: Video shows a Tesla car driving and parking itself
body: A four-minute video shows a Tesla car driving completely by itself and parking in an empty lot without any human assistance. The car is fitted with eight 360-degree cameras and twelve sensors that can distinguish between hard and soft objects. A radar allows the car to 'see' through heavy rain, fog, dust and even the car ahead.

headline: All new Tesla cars to have full self-driving capabilities
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced on Wednesday that all vehicles currently in production by the electric carmaker will have a fully self-driving hardware. The hardware, being installed on Tesla's Model S, X and forthcoming Model 3 sedans, will make the cars "substantially safer than a human driver". The cars will have 8 cameras with 360-degree viewing and 12 ultrasonic sensors.

headline: LeEco delays car unveiling due to Transformers director
body: Chinese technology firm LeEco, which unveiled its autonomous electric vehicle LeSee Pro in US on Wednesday, was unable to display the car on stage. The car was delayed on its way from London where it was being used by Transformers director Michael Bay for the latest instalment of the movie. The car was made available for viewing after the event.

headline: New car brand unveils first car with a dedicated app store
body: Chinese automotive manufacturing company Geely has launched a new car brand called  Lynk & Co that claims its electric compact SUV '01' is "the most connected car in the world". The 01 is said to have the first dedicated app store for cars that includes a feature through which users can give friends access to the car through digital keys.

headline: Why Tesla Model X’s doors open and close automatically
body: Elon Musk Co-founded electric vehicle startup Tesla's Model X, which was launched in 2015, automatically opens and closes its doors to drop off owners. The feature is a part of Tesla's larger plan to make cars able to drop its owner off and park itself. Musk on Wednesday revealed his plan to have fully self-driving capabilities in company's new cars.

headline: LeEco unveils Android-based 'Super Bike' in US debut
body: Chinese technology company LeEco on Wednesday unveiled its Android-enabled 'Super Bike' in the US. The bike has a 30-speed shift, fingerprint scanner, built-in alarm and location tracker along with a 4-inch display touchscreen between the handlebars. While the price of the 7,090 mAh battery model has not been revealed, LeEco's bikes sell in China at a range of $800-$6,000.

headline: Tesla Autopilot will run on ‘shadow mode’ to prove safety
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced on Wednesday that all Tesla cars being produced will have the hardware to achieve full Level 5 self-driving. To prove the safety of Tesla's autonomous Autopilot mode, the cars will initially run with Autopilot in the background in "shadow mode" which will register how the car would have acted if the computer was in control.

headline: Tesla targets fully self-driving road trip of over 4,400 km
body: American electric carmaker Tesla is targeting a road trip from Los Angeles to New York, covering a distance of over 4,400 km, in one of its fully self-driving cars by end of 2017. Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on Wednesday the goal was to travel from "LA to Time Square in New York and then having the car park itself".

headline: Negative media on autonomous cars killing people: Elon Musk
body: In response to a question about the safety of Tesla's autonomous systems, CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday said, "In writing some article that's negative, you effectively dissuade people from using an autonomous vehicle, you're killing people." He added that he finds the media coverage of Autopilot crashes "quite disturbing", as they are "basically almost none" relative to manual crashes.

headline: Tesla asks owners not to use self-driving cars to make money
body: Following the announcement of fitting all its new cars with fully self-driving hardware, electric carmaker Tesla has asked customers not to use the cars to earn money. "Using a self-driving Tesla for car sharing and ride-hailing for friends and family is fine, but doing so for revenue purposes will only be permissible on the Tesla Network," the company said.

headline: Self-driving car collides with truck in Singapore
body: US-based self-driving car startup nuTonomy's car on Tuesday collided with a truck in Singapore during an attempt to change the lane. No one was hurt in the accident where two engineers were onboard the self-driving car traveling slowly. In September, Uber's rival Grab partnered with nuTonomy to allow some users to book driverless cars via its app in Singapore.

headline: Kawasaki delivers bikes to buyers affected by fraud dealer
body: Kawasaki India on Tuesday announced that it had delivered 13 motorcycles to customers affected due to its fraudulent SNK Palm Beach dealership in Navi Mumbai. The Japanese motorcycle maker had terminated the showroom's dealership in September for failing to deliver motorcycles booked by users and issuing refunds for the payments made.

headline: Manufacturers to give each vehicle's detailed emission info
body: The Centre has made it mandatory for automakers to furnish detailed declaration about the emission and noise levels for each vehicle from April 2017. Information like levels of pollutants and sound level for horn needs to be provided. These rules will apply to all vehicles which run on petrol, CNG, LPG, and diesel, as well as electric and hybrid vehicles.

headline: Honda Motorcycle ranks 1st among 13 states, UTs
body: Honda Motorcycles and Scooters has become the leading two-wheeler selling brand in 13 states and Union Territories across India in June quarter, increasing from eight states/UTs last year. These 13 states/UT markets contribute half of India's total two-wheeler consumption. The growth was attributed to 'Activa', which has become India's most selling scooter.

headline: Tesla’s self-driving car hardware to cost $8,000 extra
body: The new self-driving car hardware being fitted into new Tesla cars will cost customers $8,000 (₹5,35,000) more on the company's S and X models, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said. However, he added that the software required to enable fully autonomous operation is still being tested. The cost for the upcoming Model 3 starts at $35,000 (₹23,41,000) without new hardware.

headline: Toyota's hydrogen bus 3 times powerful than Tesla Model S
body: Toyota's hydrogen fuel cell buses set to launch in 2017, will deliver 235 kWh of power, which is three times the power produced by Tesla's all-electric Model S sedan. The bus will consist of 10 high-pressure tanks holding 600 litres of compressed hydrogen. It can be used as a generator or power source in the event of disasters.

headline: Nissan completes $2.2 billion takeover of Mitsubishi
body: Japanese automobile major Nissan Motor on Thursday said that it had completed a $2.29 billion deal to acquire a controlling stake in Mitsubishi Motors. Nissan will take a 34% stake in Mitsubishi, making it the single largest shareholder in the smaller firm. Further, Nissan said it would retain Mitsubishi's CEO to ensure the automaker's recovery from a mileage cheating scandal.

headline: Aston Martin to launch one new car every year in India
body: British carmaker Aston Martin plans to launch at least one new product globally, including introducing one new super luxury car in India every year till 2020. This will include an SUV and the new Vantage, among others. With this, the London-based carmaker is aiming to strengthen its position among luxury car manufacturers in India in order to boost sales.

headline: Tata Motors hikes passenger vehicle prices by ₹12,000
body: Indian automotive company Tata Motors has announced a raise in prices of all its passenger vehicles. "We have hiked prices of our passenger vehicles by 1% ranging between ₹5,000 and ₹12,000 due to rising input costs," said a company executive, citing the increased cost of steel and zinc.

headline: McLaren offers Arctic driving experience at ₹10.22 lakh
body: British carmaker McLaren is hosting an event called 'Pure McLaren Arctic Experience', where it will let people experience driving 570S Coupe in the Arctic Circle for ₹10.22 lakh. To be held from January 15 to February 3 next year, the event will also let people spend three nights in the former home of Finland's President to witness the Northern Lights.

headline: Startup makes self-charging foldable electric bike
body: Austria-based startup Vello has created a foldable electric bike that can charge itself while the user pedals, by converting mechanical energy into electrical energy. The less than 12-kg bike has a 250-watt motor and offers top speeds of 25 kmph with a range of 50 km on a single charge. The base model can be pre-ordered for $1,899 (approximately ₹1,27,000).

headline: Harley-Davidson net income falls by 18.67% to $114 mn
body: Motorcycle manufacturer Harley-Davidson on Tuesday reported an 18.67% year-on-year decline in net income for the quarter ended September to $114.1 million. Further, weak US industry trends dragged the company's total global retail sales, which fell by 4.5%. Further, the company's revenue also fell by 3.7% to $1.27 billion during the period under review.

headline: Man restores first Honda car sold in US
body: The N600 hatchback car, which was the first Honda car sold in the US has been restored by a professional Honda restorer, Tim Mings. Tim performed a ground-up restoration, from the interior to the car's 600-cc, 9000-rpm, two-cylinder engine. The finished car was recently showcased at the Japanese Classic Car Show in California and will be preserved in Honda's museum.

headline: Jaguar Land Rover, Ford, Tata Motors testing connected cars
body: Jaguar Land Rover, Ford, and Tata Motors are testing connected cars, which can communicate with each other using technology designed to speed up journeys and cut accidents, the first such trials in Britain. These cars can warn drivers when another connected vehicle brakes suddenly and also regulate their speed to encounter fewer traffic signals.

headline: Fiat Chrysler recalling vehicles in the US, Canada, Mexico
body: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles has said that it is recalling about 74,833 vehicles in the US to replace the alternators because of a problem that could result in engine stall. The company said it was aware of a single potentially related injury. Fiat said that it is also recalling 10,077 vehicles in Canada, 1,088 in Mexico and 134 outside North America.

headline: Red Bull Racing releases documentary on history of pit stops
body: F1 team Red Bull Racing has released a documentary showing how the pit stops have changed from over-a-minute to less than three-second-long stops. The video titled 'The History of the Pit Stop - Gone in Two Seconds' also revealed how McLaren F1 designer Gordon Murray and his team used pressurised beer kegs in the 1980s to fuel a car.

headline: Fiat launches ‘The New Urban Cross’ at ₹6.85 lakh
body: Automobile major Fiat has launched the ‘The New Urban Cross’ at an introductory starting price of ₹6.85 lakh (Ex-Showroom Delhi) with powerful engines – 145PS Abarth & 93PS Powertech. The car, which is available in both diesel & petrol, comes up with 12.7cm touch-screen navigation system as standard, dual-tone interior with optional designer package, alloy-wheels, airbags & ABS with EBD.

headline: Triumph launches Bonneville T100 in India at ₹7.78 lakh
body: British motorcycle manufacturer Triumph on Tuesday launched its Bonneville T100 bike in India at a starting price of ₹7.78 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi). It comes with a 900 cc parallel-twin cylinder and a liquid-cooled engine that delivers an output of 54 hp. The bike also has a USB charging socket located under the seat.

headline: Tesla Model S becomes best-selling luxury sedan in US in Q3
body: Elon Musk Co-founded all-electric vehicle maker Tesla's Model S has become the best-selling luxury sedan in the US with 9,156 units being sold in the country in the third quarter. The sedan's sales surged 59% from last year. Mercedes-Benz S-Class and BMW 7-Series were the second and third most sold sedans in the US during the period.

headline: Mini teases its first ever plug-in hybrid model
body: British automaker Mini on Sunday teased its first petrol-electric plug-in hybrid model which will be based on its Countryman range. The engine is expected to be a 1.5-litre turbocharged three-cylinder unit with a top speed of approximately 125 kmph in the electric mode alone. The output of the car, expected to launch in 2019, is pegged to be 224bhp.
