headline: Ashok Leyland launches India's 1st indigenous electric bus
body: Hinduja Group flagship Ashok Leyland on Monday launched 'Circuit', the first zero-emission electric bus made entirely in India. Created specifically for Indian roads and passenger conditions, the bus costs between ₹1.50 to ₹3.50 crore and can travel up to 120 kilometres on a single charge. The bus has a seating capacity of 65 passengers.

headline: Mercedes self-driving car to save passengers, not bystanders
body: Global automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz's self-driving cars will choose to save the lives of its driver and passengers over the lives of pedestrians, company's executive Christoph von Hugo has said. "If you know you can save at least one person, at least save that one...Save the one in the car," he added. However, Mercedes engineers are working to prevent such situations.

headline: US technology company offers Tesla car to new employees
body: A US-based technology company, Axon is offering the yet to launch Tesla Model 3 sedans to its new employees, which include a web developer and some engineers. The sedan is being given to the employees who commit to stay in the company for at least 90 days. Existing workers are also being offered the sedan on referring three new workers.

headline: Apple gives self-driving car team 2017 deadline: Report
body: Apple has reportedly given the team working on its self-driving project called 'Project Titan' a deadline of late next year to prove the system's feasibility. Apple is said to have laid off and reassigned hundreds of employees from the Project Titan team. Earlier, Apple reportedly changed directions from building its own self-driving car to only working on autonomous car software.

headline: Uber to allow Mumbai users to book Porsches on Oct 16
body: Ride-hailing app Uber has partnered with German sports car maker Porsche to allow its Mumbai users to book the car between 2 pm to 4 pm on October 16, 2016. Porsche rides will be available under a 'Supercar' option in the app. Selected riders will also get a chance to experience Porsche's Boxster roadster and win Uber's 'Swag Baskets'.

headline: Germany asks Tesla to not use 'Autopilot' in ad
body: German Transport Minister Alexander Dobrindt has asked Elon Musk's electric vehicle maker Tesla to stop using 'Autopilot' term in its advertisement, as this might suggest drivers' attention is not needed during driving. A Tesla spokeswoman said that the company has always made it clear to the customers that the Autopilot assistance system requires drivers to pay attention all the time.

headline: Volkswagen sales highest in over 2 years in September
body: German carmaker Volkswagen’s sales rose 7.1% in September, the largest monthly gain in two-and-a-half years, the company said on Friday. The growth was attributed to a 20% jump in China, its biggest market, and persistent growth in Europe, the company added. Further, the 6.3% gain in its home region was the company's second-biggest monthly gain this year.

headline: Racing team creates 'world's most powerful Suzuki Swift'
body: Japan-based racing team D-Language claims to have created the most powerful Suzuki Swift in the world by modifying a Suzuki Swift Sport model to produce 350 horsepower. With a 1.6-litre petrol engine, the hatchback typically produces 120 hp. The car was fitted with a large turbocharger to achieve 350 hp and carbon fibre parts were added for better aerodynamics.

headline: Torq unveils electric vehicle for bomb squads
body: Torq Defense Systems has unveiled an all-terrain electric vehicle named 'LTEV', designed specifically for bomb disposal squads. The vehicle can carry the squad as well as all the necessary tools in its cargo at speeds of up to 48 kmph. It also comes with a fire suppression system, two detachable fire extinguishers and an LED spotlight.

headline: Hyperloop One raises $50 mn, hires former Uber CFO
body: American transportation technology company Hyperloop One on Thursday raised $50 million (₹334 crore) in a fresh round of funding led by Dubai-based DP World Group. The startup also hired former Uber Chief Financial Officer Brent Callinicos as a full-time strategic adviser. Hyperloop One will reportedly conduct a full-scale test of a Hyperloop system in the first quarter of 2017.

headline: Mercedes launches GLA Activity Edition in India at ₹38.51L
body: Luxury automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz on Monday launched its GLA 220 d 4MATIC 'Activity Edition' in India at ₹38.51 lakh (ex-showroom, Pune). Powered by a 2143 cc inline-4 engine, the SUV generates 167 bhp and goes from 0-100 kmph in 7.7 seconds. This marks Mercedes-Benz India's sixth SUV launch and the ninth product for 2016.

headline: Bike-hailing startup partners Bajaj Finance for easy loans
body: Gurgaon-based on-demand bike taxi startup Baxi has partnered with Bajaj Finance to procure loans with minimum processing fees and low down payment. These loans will be provided to salaried individuals who want to buy new bikes with the option to operate on a ride-share basis for Baxi. Founded in 2015, the startup claims 3,000 daily rides in Gurgaon and Faridabad.

headline: Luxury carmaker Lexus to debut in India with three models
body: Toyota-owned luxury vehicles maker Lexus is reportedly set to debut in India by the end of this year, by launching three models namely the RX SUV, the ES sedan and the RC-F coupe. The Lexus ES sedan could come with a hybrid variant. With initial dealerships in Delhi and Mumbai, Lexus is expected to price the sedan under ₹1 crore.

headline: Startup's first electric car to rival Tesla's Model S
body: Silicon Valley startup Atieva's first electric car, to be unveiled in December 2016, reportedly resembles rival Tesla's Model S sedan. The car, which will be called 'Atvus', will be a four-door sedan, like a Model S. Earlier in September, the company's deputy general manager had revealed that the car will accelerate from 0-100 kmph in under three seconds.

headline: Volkswagen to step up savings amid emissions row: Report
body: Amid attempts to deal with its diesel emissions scandal, Volkswagen's CEO Matthias Müller said that savings will be heavy and won't be done "without pain", a German newspaper reported. "The effects of this crisis...will go to the limits of what we can bear," he added. The German carmaker is facing a $15.3 billion settlement for rigging emission tests since 2009.

headline: GM's car-sharing firm starts operating in San Francisco
body: General Motors-owned car-sharing platform Maven started operations on Friday in San Francisco. The service rents out GM vehicles, including the Chevrolet Volt hybrid electric vehicle and the Cadillac Escalade SUV, with prices starting at $8 per hour. Cars can be booked and unlocked via an app, and have to be returned at the same spot.

headline: New BMW 5 series to be 1st car with wireless Apple CarPlay
body: German automaker BMW's 2017 5 series will be the first vehicle to feature Apple's wireless CarPlay infotainment system. Drivers will no longer have to connect their iPhone via USB to replace the car’s central software with Apple’s version. This will allow the phone and its apps to be operated via the in-car screen via touch control or an iDrive Controller.

headline: Missouri 17th US state to sue Volkswagen over emissions scam
body: The state of Missouri sued Volkswagen on Monday, becoming the 17th US state to take legal action against the German automaker over its cheating on diesel emissions. Volkswagen has already agreed to pay a total amount of $16.7 billion in settlements related to its use of illegal software to defeat emissions testing in the US.

headline: Ford F-Series Super Duty launch delayed over 'parts issues'
body: American carmaker Ford delayed the launch of its latest F-Series Super Duty truck, over unspecified "parts issues", according to a union official at Ford's Kentucky factory. It is "impossible to build all of the lost units in the third-quarter", and can negatively affect Ford's third quarter earnings, the official added. The 2017 Super Duty is priced starting at $32,500.

headline: Ford to temporarily shut production at 4 plants
body: Ford Motor on Monday said it will shut the production of its best-selling F-150 pickup truck for a week at a US assembly plant, and temporarily idle three other plants within few weeks. About 13,000 hourly workers will be laid off. This comes amid Ford lowering its 2016 profit forecast following a charge in the September quarter for vehicle recalls.

headline: Genovation launches Corvette-based EV at ₹5 crore
body: US-based electric vehicle manufacturer Genovation has started accepting pre-orders for its upcoming model, a C7 Corvette Grand Sport based all-electric vehicle, priced at around ₹5 crore. The vehicle's motor delivers 660 hp and takes less than three seconds to hit 100 kmph, with a 210-km range. Further, the car's exterior is reportedly modified with an environment-friendly composite material.

headline: Porsche's first race car featured on Jay Leno's show
body: Popular television host and comedian Jay Leno this week featured the first race car ever campaigned by Porsche, in his garage show. The 1951 Porsche 356 SL Gmund Coupe had made its debut at the Le Mans Grand Prix, winning the 1100 cc class. The car was brought to the US after Porsche discarded it after the race.
